name: Ikwa Headband
description: This headband shows that your master believes you've mastered the path of the drunken warrior. It also proves that you are now a widely respected Pandawushuka.

name: Nikwa Headband
description: This headband shows that your master believes you've mastered the path of the five claws. Pandawan elements have no secrets for you!

name: Sankwa Headband
description: This headband shows that your master believes you've mastered the path of the shield. You are now as solid as rock and as elusive as the wind.

name: Yonkwa Headband
description: This headband shows that your master believes you've mastered the path of the sabre. You are now one of the finest blades among the Pandawushuka.

name: Gokwa Headband
description: This headband shows that your master believes you've mastered the path of the staff. You can now keep an arm's length away from your opponents and still whack them soundly.

name: Pandawushuka Apprentice Headband
description: This headband marks the first step towards becoming a Pandawushuka. Patience and self-control are the qualities needed for the long apprenticeship before you.

name: Rokwa Headband
description: This headband shows that your master believes you've mastered the path of the fist and that your apprenticeship as a Pandawushuka has only just begun.

name: Aqua Codex
description:
This codex contains useful formulas such as how to transform shower water into bathwater. This explains why apprentice sorcerers prefer to use it as a mount.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Shushum Codex
description:
This spellbook is possessed by a Shushu who was sentenced for having encouraged adventurers to listen to the complaints of other Twelvians rather than letting those same adventurers merely nod without listening and then complain they don't understand the mission they had just accepted.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Terra Codex
description:
After realising that the formulas contained in this spellbook provided for better burial of the dead without the need for a shovel, the necromancer Sadrax cursed it and turned it into a mount for Chafers.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Ignis Codex
description:
This treatise contains all of grandmama's secret formulas to systematically overcook everything. It ran away when she tried to make it taste her newest recipe – flambéed Chafer's pie.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Aeris Codex
description:
When you hop aboard this flying book, you can visit the clouds and crash miserably down on the bottom of a valley after a poorly executed aerial loop.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Magicae Codex
description:
Despite its many years of perfect service, this spellbook was abandoned along the side of the road by Larry Poller when he went to pick up the latest model nim bus.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Viootifool Cape
description:
Silvia herself sewed this cape together from old curtains. The result looks more like a mop that's been boiled in Lousy Pig blood. It just goes to show you can always do worse.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Champion Cape
description:
This splendid cape comes standard with epaulettes so you'll finally look like a real champion.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Champion Belt
description:
With this low-slung belt around your hips, you'll finally be able to hide your least flattering attributes.
(Place this belt over another, already-equipped belt to change its appearance.)

name: Indifferent Coney Cape
description:
The power of this cape? When you turn your back to someone, your utter indifference will cause them to weep instantly. Only for the very spiteful among you.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Satanass Hat
description:
Satanass was a figure skater slicing up pretty much everywhere, taking part in prestigious contests and enlivening second-rate galas. While recovering from a broken tailbone, he had a life-changing revelation: his destiny was to be the most talented Dragokart driver of his generation! A little bump can sometimes leave a hefty lump.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pepitoo's Sombrero
description:
This sombrero belonged to a sombre Xelor hero nobody hears from any more. The last time Pepitoo was sighted, he was serenading his beloved. What is more, they say his fiancée's brothers were in the know about the whole thing. Still others say he was whisked away into a parallel dimension just like that. The mystery has never been solved…
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Bee Hat
description:
By wearing this hat, you have to accept that you're running the risk of being hit by a Moskitoswatter.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Piggibits
description:
These ears are still warm, and they'll let you seduce any Lousy Pig you meet. Don't laugh; you still don't know how lonely you can get in the Cania Plains.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Cork Cloak
description:
Also known as the "Cloak Screw", this item of clothing will be of no use for uncorking bottles. Admit that you're disappointed.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Eastern Wood Cape
description:
This cape will protect your back from getting sunburnt. Be careful: it doesn't go all the way down to every adventurer's buttocks. It is therefore advised you wear underpants if you don't want to show your backside to the whole world.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Crystalline Cape
description:
This huge piece of crystal can be used as a cape, albeit a rather stiff one. This item of clothing may be uncomfortable, but the next monster that tries to devour you will surely cut themself on it.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Poshat
description:
If nothing else, the pin nailed into this hat will shrink a big-head…
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: The Godfather's Cape
description:
This cape will protect your neck from the wintry weather and your behind from low blows…
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Bedazzling Horns
description:
The legend says that these horns were used as a lightning rod, concentrating lightning for several hours and then projecting bolts towards any unwary people who came too close. Another legend says they just make their wearer look ridiculous.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: The Chatlin
description:
This hat comes with a fake toothbrush moustache, which is nice until you find yourself mistaken for a great dictator.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Chisp Shield
description:
Ponch proudly wore this shield as he sat mounted on his Dragoturkey and ensured the safety of the streets of Bonta.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Chisp Helmet
description:
This helmet will protect the skull of its wearer should they fall off a Dragoturkey. It also makes you look like an idiot, even if you aren't one.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Noke's Mask
description:
Noke loved to put on this mask and hide in the woods to terrify lost ramblers. He died a long time ago after seeing his reflection in a puddle.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Noke's Daggers
description:
A long time ago, there was an aggressive boar that dreamt of becoming a stag. These daggers were used to carve it up.
(Place this daggers over another, already-equipped daggers to change its appearance.)

name: Ughat
description:
This headgear will keep your ears protected from cold and your friends' bad jokes.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Toot's Helmet
description:
Only a Gobbowl player would come up with the crazy idea of disguising themselves as a Tofu to intimidate their opponent. Mind you, this helmet's aerodynamic shape allows the wearer to slice through the air like a missile. Maybe it's not such a crazy idea after all. Well, whatever, you'll certainly stand out from the crowd.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Master Dagger Smith's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Miner's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Dagger Smithmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Axe Smithmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Bow Carvmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Wand Carvmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Shoemagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: The Black Crow's Cloak
description:
Some thread, a needle, a few feathers taken from the remains of decaying Crobaks, and voilà! You're in possession of the most chic of cloaks!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Frost Hat
description:
This hat is ideal for keeping your head cool and your ideas fresh. That said, if you don't want to look like an ugly ice cube, you'll have to find something else.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Capocalypse
description:
This hat is so tight-fitting that it compresses the skull and causes strong hallucinations. Fortunately, Goultard wore it when he was young, and what's more, he has quite a small skull, which betrays his roots.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Clementine Hat
description:
Slap this hat on your head, peel it for a few hours, and eventually, if you're lucky, you might find a tiny pip.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Lonne's Hat
description:
Before being worn by Lonne Jenone, this hat belonged to Sergeant Payper, who was a rather quiet chap rarely prone to sticking his oar in.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Gadjet's Hat
description:
Gadget was one of the most creative handymen the World of Twelve has ever seen. Unfortunately, he was also one of the most daft. They say he mistook his wife's head for his anvil on more than one occasion, although she didn't complain, apparently.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Gadjet's Cape
description:
Gadget made this cape in the hope that it might enable him to fly and thus more easily escape the beatings administered daily by his wife.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Poppinz Hat
description:
This hat isn't waterproof, and as a result, you'll have to use a ridiculous umbrella wherever you go.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: The Hive
description:
Hives are rare, very rare. Because bees are our friends, because we like to spread our bread with good honey, because our flowers like to be pollinated, we carry our own hives! And from these chambers, the juice of these adorable little things, worthy heirs of the mythical little goddess Beebee, will flow.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Stroud's Hat
description:
Fed up of being mistaken for a slob because of his hat, Stroud had the ingenious idea of attaching a kama to it with a piece of Minotoror leather. The result was immediate: people mistook him for a wrinkled old skinflint instead.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Wicked Protector
description: This light, airy shield is great for showing off with, but not much more. For once, however, you merit your fifteen minutes of fame, so make the most of them.

name: Bearendizer's Belt
description:
Certain adventurers claim that Bearendizer, in order to become the most powerful of all the Bearbarians, sold his soul to Djaul and, since then, his physical incarnation has been controlled by the bee on his shoulder, Actahive. This is only a rumour, though, and they're probably just trying to justify the fact that they're not very muscular.
(Place this belt over another, already-equipped belt to change its appearance.)

name: Tetra Cloak
description:
Warning: It seems that if you line up with other adventurers while wearing this cape, you might make them disappear.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Pandalida Cloak
description:
Drape yourself in this cloak and adopt your most romantic look, squint slightly, and stare deep into the eyes of your heart's latest desire. They'll fall instantly. Down dead, that is.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Nam Cape
description:
With this cape on your back, you'll constantly have the feeling that someone's following you. It'll guarantee a non-stop flow of adrenaline, but is also likely to lead to acute paranoia.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Librarian Amulet
description:
This little amulet is proof of your love of books, libraries and old, bespectacled owls. You can also use it as a bookmark.
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Hapony
description:
Put on this hat, get down on all fours and any adventurers who cross your path will think they've discovered a new breed of mount that's infinitely nicer and cuter than Dragoturkeys. Then, impale those trusting nincompoops with your horn. Or let them take you for a ride. Whichever you prefer.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Eiderdape
description:
Showing off this cape, decorated with beautifully coloured feathers, you should have the object of your affections falling at your feet. Just make sure you don't get your feet caught in it, though, or you could end up falling at theirs.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Stroud's Shovel
description:
This shovel can do everything: dig earth, collect kamas, stun bandits and even repel your mother-in-law. As you can see, it's pretty much essential.
(Place this shovel over another, already-equipped shovel to change its appearance.)

name: Hot Staff
description:
This Hot Staff, often used as a dumbbell by the show-offy warriors of the World, is sought high and low on Pandala. It's fairly rare to come by so you'll want to hold on to this one - the carvers have a shortage of the raw materials needed to make it and consequently the ecosystem is gravely suffering.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Imakape
description:
It's said that the hem of this cape makes flowers bloom wherever it skims along the ground, even in the most desolate landscapes. Oddly enough, when you're the one wearing it, these flowers wilt immediately. Must be something to do with your armpit hygiene.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Diplocape
description:
With this cape on your back, you'll feel ready to defend your planet like a hero.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Diplohelmet
description:
Your enemies will find you adorable; you remind them of childhood memories. But rest assured, they'll kill you all the same.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Sewears
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Koolich Aid
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Oafblocke Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Witter Beanie
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: T'Youb
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Oddrick Cloak
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Shadow Helmet
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Cheekrescent
description:
Now here's a weapon that left Cra herself scratching her head. She turned it this way and that, examined all the seams, and she still couldn't understand why it was so popular with her disciples. Sure, it's got a light draw and it's machine-washable, but its combat-worthiness remains to be seen.
(Place this bow over another, already-equipped bow to change its appearance.)

name: Hattee
description:
Pro-tip: if you wear this hat as protection during a storm, wring it out later and you've got cheap tea.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Sekyoo Ratee
description:
Unlike Enutrofs, your feet, and your mother's cooking, this shield is fresh and smells great!
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Black Quakask
description:
Thanks to this helmet, your fantasies of being treated like a bad little ducky can become reality!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Yellow Quakstik
description:
Pandawushu masters are able to catch a Moskito mid-flight with two of these wands in the same hand. Not surprising really, when you consider the viscous slime they're usually covered in after being used to dig for nostril treasure.
(Place this wand over another, already-equipped wand to change its appearance.)

name: Airmees Shovel
description:
You wanted a bow capable of shooting arrows of pure light across the Krosmoz. Unfortunately, you spoke to the wrong artisan and ended up with this shovel instead.
(Place this shovel over another, already-equipped shovel to change its appearance.)

name: Makizushield
description:
Pandikazes use this shield not only to protect themselves but also to stave off starvation during long periods of isolation.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Pink Dragoocape
description:
The wise men, who are paid to do nothing in particular, have oft wondered what happened to the skins of the animals the butcher killed. Now they know.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Domesticap
description:
This diadem is to this set as a cherry is to a cake: useless, but indispensable.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Domestick
description:
Before becoming a weapon, the Domestick was a tool used for all sorts of housework. It could be used to dust the shelves, clean the oven, and even to administer a well-deserved spanking for the lady or the man of the house.
(Place this wand over another, already-equipped wand to change its appearance.)

name: Samurai Cape
description:
A cape in the Samurai Set?! This is the work of some unscrupulous tailor who cares more about selling to his uninformed customers than he does about accuracy. It's his fault this set is not as effective as it could have been if there weren't a cape to hinder your movements in combat.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Noh Saber
description:
Since Astrubian tourists didn't understand when Pandawan women told them "No" in answer to their advances, the women looked for something more forceful. The result: this sword, which was then promptly assimilated into Astrubian culture.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Kanuckler
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sweetheart Hammer
description:
A hammer that makes you feel like a small, pink, cute, fluffy woodland creature… and yet incredibly tough at the same time!
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Skullcrasher
description:
After outwitting Gein's double, sidestepping his traps and foiling his invisibility gimmick, you really deserve this skull as a symbol of your clear-headedness. You should probably hide it if you ever come across the real Gein, of course, as it'd be a shame to be stripped of your title so soon.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Meow Daggers
description:
Kill with your claws… or stroke with your footpads.
(Change the appearance of the daggers you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto them.)

name: Meow Hat
description:
Now with free fleas.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Flashy Cloak
description:
Not only do you always feel under the weather when wearing this cloak, it doesn't even give you the flashes of inspiration you were hoping for.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Traffic Cone
description:
With this cone on your head, people will do all they can not to bump into you, turning early to give you a wide berth. Just like they do already, actually.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Groom Daggers
description:
"Greet your guests courteously, then stab them in the back when they turn away." That's your philosophy. Un-lackey for some!
(Change the appearance of the daggers you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto them.)

name: Groom Cloak
description:
This cloak has been enhanced by the addition of a dustpan and brush extension. Now you can keep on opening doors and carrying your masters' bags without needing to interrupt those all-important cleaning sessions.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Groom Shield
description:
This shield will provide effective protection from swipes and blows from certain masters. It can also be flipped and used as a platter to serve them.
(Change the appearance of the shield your are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Groom Hat
description:
Now that you have this hat, your masters will be able to keep you in their sights at all times and constantly call upon your services.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Boney-O Cloak
description:
Here today, gone to marrow!
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Boney-O Headgear
description:
With this headgear gracing your lovely crown, the Moowolf will think you look good enough to eat.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Emperor Sword
description:
Granted, it's not very sharp, but you're the Emperor, your footmen will do the cutting for you!
(Change the appearance of the sword you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Droid Shield
description:
Careful! Flaunting this shield is considered an open act of rebellion.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Raja Cloak
description:
This cloak is lined with a layer of polystyrene composite, to protect your botty from smacks.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Crossbone Cloak
description:
The crossbones signify that this cloak once belonged to a pirate or a Chafer who was an excellent arm wrestler.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Atanip Shield
description:
Once this shield is destroyed, the chomping, sucking, chewing maws of doom will reach you. At the very least, try and give them some cavities.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Mechanahat
description:
This hat makes you think of the time when celebrity tailor Kog Wan tried, in vain, to make you look good naked.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Decoded Corset
description:
This belt has traversed past, present and future to bring a message to the World of Twelve. Take good care of it, as you'll probably need it later.
(Place this belt over another, already-equipped belt to change its appearance.)

name: Al Howin's Helmet
description:
It's a fine line between fear and disgust, and you're unlikely to forget it with this helmet.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Al Howin's Cape
description:
This cape will either terrify people, or make them laugh. It all depends on the person wearing it.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Gingerbread Cloak
description:
This gingerbread cloak will entice every eager foodie. Enjoy! A real Kwismas wouldn't be complete without an upset stomach, after all.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Battler Shield
description:
Carrying this shield will ensure no one wants to pick a fight with you.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Piggy Shield
description: When wet, this shield tends to become a little salami and you may find that carrying it makes you rather ham-fisted.

name: 645 Champion Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Gerbean
description:
Do you take comfort in the idea that one can still be too cute with abundant hair, small size, foul breath, and wabbit teeth? It might be true for Gerbeans, but just wait until you meet a Stubbyob.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Exotic Shield
description: With this shield on your arm, everyone will think you’re returning from a long holiday in the islands. Too bad you didn’t get the tan to prove it!

name: Charlie's Agents Shield
description:
"She sells shell shields by the seashore, she sells shell shields by the seashore, shesellsshellshieldsbytheseashore…"
If you listen closely, you can hear a strange chant repeating faster and faster, coming from inside this shell-shaped shield.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Charlie's Agents Shovel
description:
This shovel is an essential weapon for defeating any tourists who try to make a sandcastle that's bigger and better than yours.
(Place this shovel over another, already-equipped shovel to change its appearance.)

name: Lilotte's Bell
description:
Be careful not to get your head trapped because of this bell.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Marline's Headdress
description:
Bad hair day? Can't get your locks to behave? Don't worry: just toss on this meticulously groomed headdress on your head, and everyone will be looking at you with admiration.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Monarch Cape
description:
Made entirely of velour, the collar of this cape supports the Monarch's head while he sleeps during meetings with his advisers.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Chocoshield
description:
Usually given at parties, this robust shield is nothing more than a big square of chocolate. It will delight the palates of your enemies, so busy devouring it that they won't attack you.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Fraktal Shield
description: If you look at this shield close enough, you may realise that it is made up of many miniature versions of itself, which themselves are made up of miniature versions of themselves, which in turn…

name: Bramble Cape
description:
Thanks to this cape, you can finally justify wearing tattered rags every day.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Sadida King Shield
description:
The Sadida King made this shield so he could touch wood when he found himself at a disadvantage. The fact that the Sadida King is no more today says a lot about the effectiveness of such an act.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Beaniwool
description:
In the cold winter camps of Frigost, girls have only two topics of discussion: the glorious pompom of the Beaniwool, and boys.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Giant Kralove Shield
description: Its tentacles can grab your opponent's weapon, or insert themselves into new orifices you've torn for your opponent.

name: Magma Headgear
description:
It is inadvisable to wear this headgear in summer, so as to avoid getting braised.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Measured Tofu
description:
As good as gold, but as stupid as a nutshell.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Paunchy Tofu
description:
The size of its stomach is inversely proportional to that of your brain.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Measured Bow Meow
description:
As good as gold, and as dumb as a stump.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Bontarian Bow Meow
description:
This pet has been well-raised and will follow all your rules – that is, until it gets hungry or you don't pay enough attention to it for a few seconds.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Measured Boon
description:
This pet has been given a healthy, balanced diet throughout its growth. You envy it each time you look at it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Boonax
description:
Once it's dead, you can stuff it and make quite a comfortable armchair out of it.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Marvellous Woman Shield
description:
Discreet, submissive, weak, servile, fearful, dependent: the marvellous woman doesn't have any of these qualities. She does have a wonderful look though, thanks to this shield.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Zombite Cape
description:
This cape is in such bad shape that it looks like the slightest gust of wind will tear it into shreds. And yet, it hasn't happened yet. That's the power of the zombite-attitude: "I'm still standing, even though I'm living dead" as sang the zombie minstrel, John Elton.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Jumping Knight Helmet
description:
Rumour has it that if you jump on Bump's head while he's wearing this helmet, you'll be able to do a super-jump. You may wonder who was stupid enough to come up with an idea like that when you see those blades sticking out of it.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Fouxar
description:
Unlike the Maho Firefoux, the Fouxar won't transform into a Yokai Fouxar when in combat. But it does like to roll up into a ball and hide until the fighting is over, letting you do all the work. You thought you'd managed to tame a vicious predator, but you ended up with an adorable pet instead.
(Place this petsmount over another, already equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Icky Godron
description:
Its former master forgot to teach it the basic rules of hygiene, like not having a wash more than once a year (to preserve its skin) and never brushing its teeth (to preserve the toothbrushes). Now it's a little sticky, but it's also your pet, so you love it nonetheless.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Brakmarian Godron
description:
This little dragon loves houses set ablaze, infernos and forest fires. It'll cause you trouble, but will happily help you prepare grilled food.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Bontarian Godron
description:
This little dragon is trying to spread the good word in the area by burning any ungodly hordes that would dare oppose it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Divine Helmet
description:
This helmet sends you visions from a distant astral plain, as if the gods you were whispering in your ear regarding the mysterious fate of the universe. Had you been someone else, you would have interpreted them and might have become an oracle or prophet, but fortunately, you don't understand a word of it.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Battler Cloak
description:
This thick cloak will easily cushion a few smacks on the bottom.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Royal Gobball Shield
description:
This shield was given to you by Parillia for managing to calm the Royal Gobball down. However, you have been banned from ever setting foot in Tainela again after the chaos you caused. But, as the proverb says: "You can't make peace without breaking things to pieces".
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Queen of Thieves Shield
description:
When you carry this shield, it's as if you thieved it from the Queen of Thieves herself. Oh, the irony! Is it due to your talent, a stroke of luck, or fate? Even you're not certain, but despite everything, it'll make for a rather funny anecdote to tell your friends.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Draeggosaure Headgear
description:
Careful not to get bitten when you scratch its head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Shiny Headgear
description:
The two horns on this headgear can be used as lightning rods in order to give you flashes of genius.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Nelween's Shield
description: Don't be gloomy: this is one gloaming good shield!

name: Minowang
description: The Minowang has dark fur and a feisty temperament, inherited from a childhood spent in the shadow of a mountain of fire. Being extremely stubborn, it preferred to join you rather than put its hooves up and lounge on the sandy beaches of Minotoror Island.

name: Corsair Hat
description:
The shape of this hat makes it an excellent tool for rapidly bailing out large quantities of water. Quite handy when your ship is sinking as fast as your career as a pirate and your dreams of grandeur.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Al Howin Borbat
description:
Is it a Pumpkwin with Borbat wings, or a Borbat with a Pumpkwin head?
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Hairy Cloak
description:
This thick fur cape is uniquely comfortable, perfect for facing the hardships of winter. Your friends say you look plump when you wear it, when actually, it's the hair that makes you feel puffy.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Hairy Shield
description:
With its long sharp fangs and tousled hair, this shield is fearsome enough to instil fear in your enemies' hearts. The way it resembles your mother-in-law seems to be purely by chance, even if quite obvious.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Az'Hassin Hood
description:
No more failed entrances due to gusts of wind making your hood fly off too soon – and your credibility with it. The inside frame allows the hood to stay perfectly in place, worthy of the greatest Az'Hassins. On the other hand, you won't be able to turn or raise your head, which could be a problem when you have to look right, then left, then right before crossing the street.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Prez' Doh'bi
description:
The label attached to the back of the Prez' says "from Auntie Nielleda". Better let it follow you than risk opening it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Prez' Doh'brrmann
description:
The label attached to the back of the Prez' says "from Auntie Nielleda". Better let it follow you than risk opening it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Pikip
description:
A small tree with a wandering heart, this Pikip is the perfect companion for sowing thorns into the sides of your opponents' jumpers.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Shadragon Cape
description:
This cape is very useful if you need to pass yourself off as a huge lizard or puny dragon. Be warned, however. Its wings won't let you fly, and the tail doesn't grow back, so be careful.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Karne
description:
What an odd creature it is, this Karne. Many theories abound. Some think it's an obese Tofu that grew in a skull; others prefer the version that says it's a skull animated by dark magic that caused it to grow wings and feet; while others still believe that a scientific experiment went horribly awry. One thing is sure: Karne is not the most affectionate animal ever, nor the cutest, but having it in your company will naturally give you a considerably evil aura.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Hyrkul Cape
description:
Wearing the skin of a creature you managed to kill on your back as a trophy has, over time, become extremely commonplace. Nowadays, it's unclear whether whoever is wearing the skin is indeed the author of the feat… Claiming that you've defeated a Brakmarian champion with your own hands and that you're wearing a remnant of the epic fight on your back can make you an impostor, unless you master the art of lying perfectly.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Mandibular Cloak
description:
With this cloak, the next time someone taps on your shoulder hoping to give you a start, they're the one likely to be startled.
(Place this cloak over another, already-equipped cloak to change its appearance.)

name: Mandibular Helmet
description:
This nearly-full-face helmet is ideal protection on your travels, especially when riding the more recalcitrant mounts.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Chocolate Dragoone
description:
This Dragoone looks scrumptious indeed, but comes with a sternly worded warning.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Anakronik Helmet
description:
This helmet has no business being in this world, and even less business being on your head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Snowdrift Shield
description:
When it's not pushing your friends when it shouldn't, this shield will protect you from blows and keep your cold heart from melting.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Chokao Shield
description:
While mastering subordinating conjunctions has never saved an adventurer from a bloody battle, it can save you a few kamas. If it won't spread chaos, you can eat it on toast instead of hazelnut spread… or cover it with hazelnut spread and eat it instead of toast.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Noxbow
description: The only thing original about this weapon is its name, and whoever named it couldn't be bothered.

name: Noxine
description:
This technological parasite seems to come from a different era. Despite its harmful impact on the environment, adventurers are deliriously fond of it and ready to do anything to get their hands on one.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Fleaster Targa
description:
The thin layer of praline filling between the two squares of chocolate that make up this shield absorbs blows very well. Properly wielded, this shield can even return certain attacks to their senders. You can't count on it to protect against diabetes, though.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Tylezia Diadem
description:
There's nothing more elegant than a diadem adorned with feathers to command respect but keep the mood light as a feather.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Shushield
description: The expression "make sure no one gives you the evil eye" takes on its full meaning with this shield… Except in your case, you've already been given it.

name: Torvil
description:
Torvil has always dreamed of flying, feeling light as a feather, riding an updraught, getting lost in the vastness of the sky, and watching migratory birds soar off into the horizon. Unfortunately, his status as a turtle keeps his feet firmly on the ground in the mud with the Gobballs. Still, he hasn't given up hope of one day soaring above the clouds and living his dream.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Azure Lance
description: This lance looks like a giant sweet, and you're quite safe putting it in your mouth. You simply need to like the taste of metal and varnish to truly enjoy it.

name: Bone Shield
description: This shield is used as a portable summary execution tool when you're unable to take your gallows with you.

name: Bone Helmet
description: Your pet's death made you tougher, but you still can't quite bear to be separated from it.

name: Bony Arachnee
description:
Six-legged and highly mobile, the Bony Arachnee is an all-terrain mount that allows you to visit places that are difficult to reach. Careful, though: don't forget to give it some milk from time to time to make its bones stronger, or you could find yourself in a bad way in a secluded place.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Iop Cape
description:
Some Iops who are slightly better thinkers than usual question what use the two epaulettes on this cape are, knowing that the vast majority of the Warrior God's followers already wear two of them. But the others generally agree that three epaulettes are always better than two.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Rogue Shield
description:
Young Rogues make one common mistake – using this shield right, left and centre. But they quickly learn that's not the best way to go unnoticed. You need to look unobtrusive so you don't scare your vict… err, clients.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Rogue Headgear
description:
Many use this nightmarish headgear to rascal about anonymously and strike fear in their victims' hearts.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Sram Shield
description:
The treacherous part of this shield is that it can be used as a dagger: its bone edge is extremely sharp and very effective for stabbing your enemies.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Dream Shield
description:
Some shields want to use you, some shields want to get used by you, some shields want to abuse you, some shields want to be abused…
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Dream Helmet
description:
Dream when you're feeling blue, dream, that's the only thing to do. Just put this helmet on your hair…
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Osamodas Cape
description:
This cape is the perfect chic accessory when attending a shockingly good party.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Osamodas Shield
description:
This shield was designed for Osamodas who have trouble taking a beating and would rather watch than participate actively in the hostilities.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Nightmare Feathers
description:
Draped in this black-feather finery, you can sneak into innocent villagers' homes in the dead of night to scare them, chuckling all the way. Be sure NOT to wipe your feet off when you go in, as this will up your villain game.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Cra Headgear
description:
This headgear gives off a presence that will make everyone think that you belong to the upper classes.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Feca Cape
description:
The process used to weave this cape made of Albino Arachnee silk is highly complex but produces a light, sturdy and ridiculously stretchy fabric.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Shariva Shield
description:
This shield – which is much better at decorating than protecting – shakes up preconceived notions, tilts truths, and makes legends tremble. It is also your way of proclaiming to the world: "Let Shariva laugh!"
The following inscription can also be read on the back: "Forged in the Maelstrom".

name: Foggerscot
description:
Foggernaut technology lets land creatures survive under water and lets aquatic creatures survive on dry land. This pet is living proof of that, even though the others ended their lives as toppings for seafood pizza.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Crascot
description:
When you can't afford the luxury of being accompanied by seven Cras into battle, this miniature version is the next best thing. At the very least, it won't be turned away at the entrance to the Kolossium.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Sadida Shield
description:
Sadidas have become masters in the art of plant sculptures, and this shield is decidedly one of their greatest creations.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Bronze Escuktaeon
description:
This coat of arms is a reward for young fighters who show great promise. So you see, fighting in the mud and biting your opponent's foot or pulling his ear was worth it.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Gladiabone
description:
Condemned to fight for all eternity in the arenas of the Krosmoz, this skeleton of a warrior has found a way to escape its fate by sticking to you like glue.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Xelor Headgear
description:
This helmet tends to reflect the immense void often found in the hearts – and sometimes heads – of those who wear it.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Xelor Cape
description:
Fashion trends come and go but if you can control time, you can ensure that it never goes out of fashion.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Xelor Shield
description:
There's nothing like a bit of solidity when you tend to lug your destiny around like a beloved weight.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Bamboo Dora
description:
There are doras of all sorts out there, but it seems that the bamboo this one was made out of has taken over and is still growing.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Earmuffs
description:
These very soft earmuffs will keep your big floppy ears nice and warm.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Brilliant Hermiturtlook
description:
Only slightly dated, this hat will give you a unique look – one that is sure to attract wallflowers like flies. Perfect for those warm summer night parties.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pineapi Mask
description:
This exotic, fruit-shaped mask is a real collector's item. It is absolutely useless, but you'll look original and tasty. People appreciate the effort.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pineapi Bag
description:
Made from magical Pineapi, this nothing-less-than-original bag suffers from a slight design fault: it hasn't been hollowed out. That means you can't put anything in it. And it's very heavy. A bit like a Iop who's been lost in the Astrub Tavern for several months. What's over, contrary to appearances, the Pineapi Bag is not part of the Pineapi Set. In short, it's a completely useless item, thus a vital one.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Coney Hat
description:
If you're planning to communicate with Wabbits, this might be the hat you need. If you want to look good, put it on someone next to you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Oirish Tailcoat
description:
A thirsty Pandawa went west, to see which great city was best. Not Bontarian beer, which was empty of cheer, but Brakmar's was quite full of zest!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: K Cape
description:
Roll it up in fruity jam, cover it in jelly and resist the temptation to scoff it. This treat is best enjoyed as a suppository.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Eastern Wood Hat
description:
Not as trendy as the Clint is, but a lot more elegant, this hat will show the others how sophisticated you are.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Strawaff
description:
If you ever dreamt of drinking your enemies' blood while hitting them relentlessly, this weapon's made for you!
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: St. Ballotwine's Day Hat
description:
This magic hat can only be worn by adventurers who are not yet married, and so wearing it advertises your all-consuming desire to find a soulmate to all the other tragic loners in Amakna, who will flock around you at the nearest Zaap, clucking and squawking like broody hens. Inevitably, someone will let off a few Fairyworks in a vain attempt to win your affection, but you'll end up with a splitting headache, be unable to speak, and have the feeling that you're walking through treacle.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pac-Tiger Shield
description:
This shield isn't quite a full protection guarantee for the owner, but it is great at chasing ghosts.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Cicapeda
description:
The three little balls at the bottom of this cape will enable you to give great headbutts if you learn how to spin!!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Cicad'Hat
description:
With or without this hat, you'll look like a buffoon… But with it, at least, you'll have a good excuse!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Poopapink Staff
description:
Who gave that staff such a stupid appearance? Well, no one knows… But you'll still have to brandish it in front of your enemies… no matter how stupid YOU look doing so!
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Slait Cape
description:
Two tails on one body… A dream come true – finally!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Bedazzling Double Hakken Axe
description:
This double-headed axe can cut off two heads in one swing, which equates to an eighth of a sixteen-headed hydra.
(Place this axe over another, already-equipped axe to change its appearance.)

name: Siks Wonn Ein Mask
description:
This mask not only gives you the appearance of a terrifying, murderous man-eater, it'll also protect your delicate rosy cheeks from harsh wind and hot sun.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Slamdance Mullet Hairdo
description:
Long at the back, short on top, this hairdo has a bad reputation, but you'll surely change all that.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Darth Vaydhat
description:
This helmet is perfect for people who look too kind. That can be very dangerous in the World of Twelve.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Swodor
description:
This sword's blade was soaked in concentrated firefly juice for 18 months to make it glow in the dark. It now stinks in the dark too, by the way.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: The Chapstick
description:
This flexible bamboo cane is definitely not for leaning on... try twirling it round in the air instead.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Slugly Cloak
description:
The pores of this cape exude a sticky slime. You'll look classy if you lie on your back and let it carry you along the floor.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Noke's Cloak
description:
Noke dreamt of becoming a big, bad wolf. Sadly, with this cloak on her shoulders, she was more like one of the three little pigs.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Oxo Helmet
description:
This helmet will make you into an excellent protocol Wobot thanks to a unique device that translates the Oxon language in real time. It's also soundproof.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Koninginnedag Crown
description:
To celebrate the birthday of an illustrious queen, a feast is held. This crown is usually worn on the day of the feast. Its magic is very powerful, and it can change the colour of the person who wears it to orange. This will make it easier to hide among people dressed in this colour.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Real Gobbly Shield
description:
This imposing shield bears the marks of many a Gobbowl match. However, despite its robust, intimidating appearance, it'd be of no use at all in a real fight. You'd be better off using it to play peek-a-boo with Gobblies.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Master Shoemaker's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Staff Carver's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Butcher's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Viopal Sword
description:
Heavy, clumsy, dull and ugly, just how was Goultard able to become such a formidable fighter using this mediocre sword? Wielding it yourself will not improve your skills: it will just make you look ridiculous.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Feather Hat
description:
In some tribes, the wisdom of the Chief is measured by the number of feathers on his hat. Yours has only one, and what's more, it's very small and quite grubby.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Poppinz Cape
description:
The last person who tried to use this cape to fly down from a cloud crashed into a bank.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Pinokio Hat
description:
You can also use this hat as traffic cone should you have an accident while riding your Dragoturkey.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Island Pearl Necklace
description:
This little necklace made from island pearls exudes a soft bluish aura that evokes powerful memories of adventures on the beautiful, cerulean sea.
Only the small note on the back of this exquisite piece shatters the idyllic illusion: "Made in IOW".
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)
stats: Bluish aura of the Ancestral Platypus emote

name: Percimol's Mask
description:
No one will mistake you for a Scarecrow with this mask on your pudgy little face, unless you're a Xelor dwarf or the person you're talking to is a Iop. Yes, "a" Iop, because it's pronounced Yop. So there.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Cauldron Hat
description:
Dressed up in this strange hat, you have the strangest desire to stagger off to the nearest tavern, and drink Shambrosia until you fall quietly into an apathetic stupor. A bit like you usually do, come to think of it.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Hir Hat
description:
Part of the Hir Suit, this hat will let you bungee jump using your hair.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: 639 Champion Shield
description:
Hold this shield above your head and you'll have an excellent sunshade. Unfortunately, it doesn't protect so well against mothers-in-law and ex-girlfriends.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Mr. Amakna Amulet
description:
This amulet makes you living proof that you can take pride in your appearance even in this world of bloodthirsty brutes who wallow in the mud all day. As long as those weren't the criteria by which you were chosen…
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Davyd's Cloak
description:
Once very popular, Davyd's cloak was considered a staple of any inhabitant of the World of Twelve's wardrobe because of its cheap price, high quality, its simplicity and the big pocket on the back that can be used as a backpack. Unfortunately, the bag makers soon saw to it that this cape "disappeared", since it took away the very last advantage backpacks had over cloaks.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Pongloak
description:
The circle in the middle of the Pongloak bounces off one of the sides with each step you take, making a characteristic "pong" sound. Even after years and years of use, a lot of adventurers still find it fun. Maybe the simplest games really are the best!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: 640 Champion Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Eiderdat
description:
This feathery, Turkohat-inspired hat will have your latest conquests all aflutter.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Mini-Miss Amakna Amulet
description:
So… You've been on the receiving end of the bitterness and insecurity left over from your mother's own adolescence; and you've spent your childhood believing that the only ambition worth following was to win a beauty contest. Now that you've braved thousands of makeup sessions, heinous costumes and camera flashes… and been voted one of the beauties of your generation… Was it worth it?
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: O'Basan Spade
description:
O'Basan was an Enutrof who was convinced that her magic spade made her shrink at unexpected moments, allowing her to understand animals. Unfortunately, she couldn't think of any "magical" excuses for her crumbling bones, severe deafness and deteriorating sight that stopped her from recognising her friends and family.
(Place this shovel over another, already-equipped shovel to change its appearance.)

name: Sirloin Cloak
description:
Wearing this cloak is the best thing to get your enemies drooling with envy.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Golden Hispañic Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Boss Saw
description:
This buzz saw is the most important piece of a bloodthirsty killing machine from another time. Unfortunately, you're missing all the other pieces. This bit will do as a shield for the moment – just make sure you don't lose a hand to it.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Brrrito Cloak
description:
Ah! What better cloak than one made of leather from an antediluvian Woolly Piggoth to protect you from the icy winds of Frigost? It didn't do that good a job taking care of its original owner, of course, but beggars can't be choosers.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Just Cloak
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: White Nincap
description:
Despite his benevolent nature, or maybe because of it, the White Ninja has completely disappeared from public awareness. So he fashioned his hat after that of his eternal rival: the Black Ninja.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Maski
description:
For the first time ever, your face will make the people of Amakna drool with desire. A great way to be desired without having to call on the neighbourhood surgeon/butcher.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Samurai Sword
description:
This sword, with a blade as sharp as an Ecaflip's senses, excels both at cutting off limbs and cutting up sushi. For seppuku however, you might prefer this sword's little brother.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Noh Cape
description:
The Noh Cape is, first and foremost, designed to go nicely with the Noh Mask. Since it doesn't have its own curse, it simply amplifies the mask's.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Karnaval Headdress
description:
Although there's no law forbidding you from wearing the Karnaval Headdress all year round, you ought to know that donning it when it's not Too-Faux Karnaval weekend is seen as a sure-fire fashion faux-pas.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Sweetheart Shield
description:
The most important part of any lover's set. If wearing your heart on your sleeve backfires, you'll have a great big red shield to protect yourself from rejection!
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Kamakap
description:
Strapped on tightly, the Kamakap is completely stable and won't drop any kamas. You should still only wear it if you're a good head taller than the average Enutrof, or else you'll have been robbed before you can say "easy money".
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Flashy Headgear
description:
The ears on this headgear act like two lightning rods. Finally, you've fulfilled your dream and become a conductor!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Traffic Blammer
description:
Just right for smashing up all the hard work your co-workers did yesterday.
(Change the appearance of the hammer you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Boney-O Shield
description:
This shield might save your life if you ever find yourself up against carnivorous enemies. Chuck it into the fray and run for your life!
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Mandrog
description:
Its little tadpole face reminds you of someone… But who?
(Change the appearance of the pet you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Emperor Cape
description:
This cape's little epaulettes will remind all the snotty toerags to call you "Boss".
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Droid Headgear
description:
If you rub this helmet up the right way, it might just show you the hologram it's storing.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Raja Wand
description:
With this wand, you can show your guests the door when they prove themselves to be wittier than you at your dinner parties.
(Change the appearance of the wand you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Crossbone Shield
description:
This shield is supposed to protect your bones from bad cracks, but it's not much good against crones with bad backs.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Mechanacloak
description:
This cloak contains enough cogs and gears to run an entire old-school merry-go-round.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Gingerbread Shield
description:
This shield made of particularly soft gingerbread is very absorbent and can withstand most attacks. Its wonderful smell will remind you of the holidays and make combat so much more enjoyable. Mind you don't get carried away and eat it up, though. That tends to happen faster than you'd think…
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Gingerbread Staff
description:
The wonderful spicy odour of this gingerbread-shaped staff will rub off onto every monster that you hit with it. You'll feel like you're in the middle of a Kwismas market! So hit them, and hit them again!
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Twit Shield
description: When wearing this shield, you will be visible from afar. This allows anyone to keep tabs on your exhilarating adventures and know where you are at all times, including any stops you make at Astrub Inn.

name: Joris's Hood
description:
This hood might not make you as clever as Joris, but it will protect your head if the blows start raining down on you, no matter how stormy it gets.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Bigoks Shield
description:
An ideal protection from any projectiles that may be thrown during the match, this shield will be your most valuable ally in getting out of the stadium in one piece.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Bigoks Helmet
description:
This helmet in your favourite team's colours will make you the ultimate fan! Now all you have to do is yell "Go Bigoks!" in the Gobbowl stadium on a game night and hope your team doesn't lose miserably.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Redroz Helmet
description:
The spike on the top of this helmet makes it perfect for charging anyone who thinks their team is better than yours.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pamus Helmet
description:
Pamus supporters who wear this accessory aren't afraid of showing their colours. And if you ask them why, they'll tell you, "Because the Pamus are gonna give you a red card! Or else we'd be happy to paint you black and blue!"
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Rando Geta
description:
In mastering the ancestral art of Roshambo, you have finally come to understand the profound meaning of the expression "a rolling Rock crushes no Paper".
(Place these boots over a pair of already-equipped boots to change their appearance.)

name: Bakara's Headband
description:
Sensitive about those big ears of yours? Here's a good way to hide them.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Royal Guard Sword
description:
This sword is the weapon wielded by the Royal Guards to protect the great city of Bonta. Don't use it as a toothpick…
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: 1001 Claws Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dragorace Cape
description: These wings won't let you fly, but will have you looking like a winner during your next race atop a Dragoturkey. (Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Seaside Cape
description:
This lovely cape is the perfect adornment for a gentle summer's night.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Dramak Shield
description: This shield may not give you an innate talent for acting, but it makes for a perfect defence against projectiles of all kind which your potential spectators could throw at you.

name: Korriander Shield
description: Korriander leaves may not be a source of vitamin K, but the sturdiness of their structure allows them to be used to make a shield which is perfectly "kunbreakable".

name: Battler Helmet
description:
This helmet commands respect, whoever's wearing it.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Crown of Brambles
description:
With this crown on your head, Treechnids might mistake you for Chopperella. So, don't be surprised if while walking through the forest, a woodland prince suddenly puts his knobbly lips to yours.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Trool Hunter's Shield
description:
Once recognisable from kilokametres away due to their appearance, the Trools have become experts of disguise. Posing as quite normal individuals to more easily spread chaos, there's been a marked increase in the number of them in the civilized world. In order to combat this scourge, some adventurers with sharpened senses have decided to take up arms and wear this shield as a distinguishing sign. Be careful though, because there might be some Trools who are smarter than the others hiding in their ranks.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Cloowk
description:
Like your soulmate, this cape will keep you warm despite its basic appearance, and you won't be able to go out without it on your back.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Guild Cape
description: Proudly wear this cape to show everyone how committed you are to your Guild.

name: Kickroach's Shield
description: You may have been a dunce at school, but you're unbeatable when it comes to torturing and massacring defenceless insects. The benefits of playing truant, most likely.

name: Zadioc Cloak
description: From behind, you'll look like a knight running away.

name: Zadioc Shield
description: This shield will be the object of your opponents' desire until they realise that it didn't stop you from being ground to crumbs in your last fight.

name: Icky Tofu
description:
As sticky as the forehead of a Bwork who's got acne.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Brakmarian Tofu
description:
This particularly cheeky and undisciplined pet will give you the run-around. In comparison, raising children is a bed of roses.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Bontarian Tofu
description:
This pet has been well-raised and will follow all your rules – that is, until it gets hungry or you don't pay enough attention to it for a few seconds.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Charming Bow Meow
description:
It's difficult to resist it when it wiggles its little behind while cooing each time you go to pet it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Brakmarian Boon
description:
Its piercing eyes will make you feel guilty every time you refuse to give it some kibble.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Extravagant Shield
description:
In addition to giving you presence and originality, this shield will protect you from your enemies' mortal blows in the middle of the battle. But when you open your mouth, it won't protect you from the sarcasm and jeers when people realise you don't actually have any personality to speak of. It's a risk you'll have to take.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Toxic Mask
description:
It's hard to know if Toxine wore this mask as protection from the most dangerous poisonous gases, or to protect her allies from her fetid breath.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Green Ninja Shell
description:
The Green Ninja's shell is useful for both holding its weapons and protecting its rear. In your case, it's also handy for hiding your spinal malformation and your huge bum.
(Place this cape over another, already equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Air Knight Shovel
description:
With this multi-functional shovel, the Air Knight can fight off his enemies and repot pumpkins in his vegetable patch. Rather practical, don't you think?
(Place this shovel over another, already equipped shovel to change its appearance.)

name: Air Knight Helmet
description:
According to the Air Knight, this helmet is the most aerodynamic helmet ever made. Experts all agree that this title actually belongs to the Wind Kwak Headdress, but they're also keen to point out that the knight's helmet is also "really cool".
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Measured Godron
description:
This small dragon is so shy that it'll never dare even declare its flame of love for you.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Paunchy Godron
description:
This little dragon has stockpiled a serious amount of food for its next nap, which may well last several centuries. It must have followed its master's example.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Count Harebourg's Shield
description: Legend has it that you received this shield because of your exceptional monster-massacring and noble-disembowelling skills. Only those who witnessed the scene know that you were simply in the right place at the right time.

name: Divine Cape
description:
This cape, also known as "The Adornment of the Gods", is known for its immaculate whiteness. Rumour has it that nothing can sully this cape, but it wasn't counting on your diet, mainly consisting of fatty foods, and your messy passion for sliding in the mud.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Primordial Artificer's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Primordial Carvmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Scarab Helmet
description: There was once a vast underground city called Gazjol-Nureb, where Scarabs – those proud giant beetles – had prospered for centuries. But their civilisation disappeared one day in mysterious circumstances… Archaeologists hypothesise that the terrible King Lytch was responsible, but nothing has been proven definitively. All that's left of these legendary insects are the Scaraleaves, their closest living relatives.

name: Crypt Shield
description:
Filled with powerful magic, this shield will protect you from crypts. You can, of course, get attacked in a crypt, but not by the crypt itself, or so your friends tell you. It's clear that those oblivious fools have never been attacked by a garden shed, or they'd have bought this shield too.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Draeggosaure Shield
description:
You are finally equipped to play the Kikousaure!
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Crocabulia's Shield
description: Turn this shield upside down and you can dig its horns into the ground to use it like a hoe or a rake.

name: Gladiator Shield
description:
