This shield's appearance is determined by your performance in the Kolossium. You can claim you deserve better and that your allies kept you from doing better, but the shield doesn't lie.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Malicious Shield
description:
This shield is probably the result of a prank.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Malicious Cloak
description:
This cape renders you invisible, but only in total darkness.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Az'Hasstwo Shield
description:
You might be surprised at there being a shield in an Az'Hassin's paraphernalia, but it actually has a very simple explanation. In fact, apprentices sometimes mess up their first attempts at murder, so they are given a shield to try and survive after having failed miserably to kill a defenceless person by surprise.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Az'Hassin Daggers
description:
These daggers were made for sneaking up on opponents, but it became apparent that they also had another very special ability. Indeed, if you are attacked head-on and you manage to counter the attack with these daggers, your body will – on its own – move to counterattack and kill your opponent for sure. If your enemies had the intelligence to attack all of you at the same time, you wouldn't have a chance, but since they stubbornly line up and attack one at a time, you'll massacre them.
(Place this weapon over another, already-equipped weapon to change its appearance.)

name: Headgear of Mystery
description:
Highly appreciated by fans of investigations, puzzles and other disciplines that lead to headaches, this headgear has its own mystery, which has not been solved to this day: why do those who wear it grow a magnificent moustache when they equip it? The most-accepted theory (but not necessarily the most correct one) is that no one can solve an investigation without a big moustache.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Dakal
description:
Not all dragons are creatures of legend and creators of Dofus with unparalleled powers. Some are much smaller and weaker, but they've been able to exploit their metamorphic abilities to perfection to trick gullible adventurers. Many of these adventurers do not see through the trickery and are all too happy to parade about with what they believe to be a primordial dragon at their heels, letting them sponge off them.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Mikhal
description:
Not all dragons are creatures of legend and creators of Dofus with unparalleled powers. Some are much smaller and weaker, but they've been able to exploit their metamorphic abilities to perfection to trick gullible adventurers. Many of these adventurers do not see through the trickery and are all too happy to parade about with what they believe to be a primordial dragon at their heels, letting them sponge off them.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Mandibular Bow
description:
This bow is the only one made from Cyclouse carapaces. It'd be a shame to forgo owning such a rare item.
(Place this bow over another, already-equipped bow to change its appearance.)

name: Mandibular Shield
description:
Your enemies are likely to grit their teeth when they see you with this shield.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Anakronik Shield
description:
The origin of this shield is still a great mystery; no one knows where it came from, nor what it's made of. However, some use it as a dice tray when games get heated.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Noxmask
description: This mask was designed for adventurers who've always dreamt of being known for their bright ideas but never have any ideas, bright or otherwise.

name: Tailcoat Cloak
description:
Sometimes it's wiser to adapt one's adornment to the world around you. Even though it might mean compromising your references.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Observant Shushield
description: The expression "make sure no one gives you the evil eye" takes on its full meaning with this shield… Except in your case, you've already been given it.

name: Vidi Helmet
description:
While it won't help your eyesight any, this helmet will make sure you're seen.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Petal Cape
description:
This cape can't be worn year-round, but as soon as the sun is out, it blooms! Its colour and smell will leave a lasting impression on everyone you meet.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Flowery Headgear
description:
What could be better than a floral ensemble to express your love of nature? In these troubled times, you'll remind everyone to respect what was here before you and what will remain after you've gone.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Armoured Tortoise
description:
As a well-known fable says, there's no point in being fast if you don't leave on time. With this petsmount, you won't be the first to get there, but you'll still reach your destination. What's more, its exceptional longevity makes the Armoured Tortoise a perfect gift for whichever successor you name.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Azure Helmet
description: This helmet's aerodynamic shape shows that it was designed to be worn on the back of a mount, unless it's to help you withstand the wind you'll get in the face.

name: Bone Falchion
description: Initially designed to mutilate, this weapon can also be used to mutilate or mutilate. The only limit to how you use it is its designer's imagination.

name: Bone Cape
description: You alone know whether your father- or mother-in-law was used in this cape's design. That way, you can always complain about your in-laws being on your back.

name: Skrull
description:
Rather playful and a little vicious, the Skrull is the perfect companion to paint the town red throughout the World of Twelve. If you feel like crushing someone's party, look no further: the Skrull is for you.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Iop Tiara
description:
This tiara puts an end to the stereotype of the abusively virile warrior who wears a 200-kilopod wrought-iron helmet, a 3-kametre-long sword covered with the blood of his enemies, and a shield the size of a door. This tiara brings a certain breath of fresh air to Iops' image. However, that won't stop some of them from using it as a weapon in a fistfight if the situation warrants it. As the saying goes, a leopard cannot change its spots!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Primate Ears
description:
Even though this is clearly a fake pair of ears, seen from afar, people will think that you can hear everything and will be careful not to say bad things about you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Dreamagon
description:
If petting a dreamy creature has always been a pipe dream of yours, now you can.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Kirino
description:
Young sleep-deprived parents are snapping up this pet. That's because it loves to snack on bad dreams, making it your best ally for peaceful nights.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Wild Pawncho
description:
This cape requires special care to keep its fur soft and silky, and the claws that drag on the ground tend to get dirty quickly.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Spoopy Boar
description:
Its spotted pelt doesn't make it as fast as a Bow Meaguar, but it will give you a killer look.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: 15th Anniversary Shield
description: This shield was made from bricks thrown by the angry mob that appears every time the World of Twelve undergoes a major change.

name: Kwismas 649 Treetop
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dream Dreamshield
description: It's not enough to just move forward through life, you have to dream of your destination.

name: Dorulphe
description:
Dorulphe isn't the strongest, Dorulphe isn't the fastest, but he'll always be there on cold and frosty mornings.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Turtelonia's Shield
description:
When you show off this shield, you can be sure that Turtelonia is sulking on moonless nights.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: War Gobbalrog
description:
This mount has a reputation for responding to every twitch of a finger, every wink, and every sound its rider makes. This last point is extremely important and has been the cause of numerous accidents. It is best to only use the words "charge", "attack", "offence", or indeed any war-related term at all in the appropriate context and circumstances.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Misery Vulture
description:
With a skilled swoop of its beak, this vulture steals anything that comes within its reach. That makes it an ideal companion for thieves and bandits. The main issue with this method is when you want to get your hands on what it stole. But then, getting your hands dirty is part of the job.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Masqueraider Headgear
description:
Wearing this mask, which was forged with the soul of a monster, you can defeat many a monster… Just take care not to become one.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Masqueraider Shield
description:
This shield is made of gold and feathers, which makes it solid and easy to wield. In addition, its sharp sides mean you can use it offensively as well as defensively should the need arise.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Griffined Cape
description:
When you asked what this cape had to do with magic, and they answered "SUIM", you concluded that they were clearly clueless: griffins can fly but aren't very fond of water. But deep down, you suspect they might not be the ones who are clueless.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Gold Escuktaeon
description:
This coat of arms rewards the most tenacious veterans and superb tacticians. The lowest of low blows and most dazzling acts have no secrets for them.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Sacrier Headgear
description:
This headgear is all the rage among Enutrofs in the middle of that awkward adolescent phase, which often includes sudden hair loss. Sacriers would have gladly done without this kind of publicity.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Megahelmet
description:
This helmet is perfect for excelling in the most extreme situations and the most exclusive company.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Viootifool Helmet
description:
This helmet once belonged to old Jojo, a renowned hero of times gone by. He is world famous for his epic travels, but it's still hard to understand the legendary devotion of his fans.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pineapi Cape
description:
Some adventurers complain that this cape is as rough as a Crocodyl's skin, and others say that it's even coarser than a Bwork's bottom. So, by careful to wear it the right way round, or you may regret it.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Wicked Sword
description:
Vlad fell in love with this wonderful sword. He entered the most terrifying of all Dragokart races to get enough money to buy it. Unfortunately, he didn't know that the sword was cursed.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Goultard's Headgear
description:
This headgear won't really make you any more fearsome or powerful… If you think for a moment that some naive souls will mistake you for Goultard, well you're crazy. Your enemies will see you coming from miles away, that's all.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Master Black Jack's Headgear
description:
The Eniripsa Master Black Jack has always been passionate about sewing. What's more, that's what led him to become an expert in stitches. A friend to tailors, he created this two-coloured headdress using inspiration from the one belonging to a cruel tailor who once massacred the Ouginaks of the Macians tribe… how charming!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: XVII's Horns
description:
If you keep trying to butt the horns off your enemies, you're the one whose head will start to resemble a sieve! The horns of XVII, the Demon of the Seventeenth Hour, are cursed: they have the power to make you forget everything… except maybe when lunch is!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: K Cap
description:
Lice used to eat your head. Not anymore: this new confectionery headgear will divert the nasty creatures. Now they'll graze on your hat instead, like a herd of tiny, white cows.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Beezing Cape
description:
The sting sticking out the end of this cape will prevent you enemies from kicking your backside, but you probably won't be able to sit down…
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Black Wab Hat
description:
Hopefully you'll look like a masked avenger wearing this hat, rather than a masked A-wenger. Alright, alright, it's been a long day -_-
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Black Wab Cape
description:
The little pompom at the end of this cape is the greatest duster ever… It's so small that it can even fit under your furniture. Don't forget to take it off when you go work in the fields.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Kwakap
description:
The wings on this cap protect you from your insults.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Alowa Cape
description:
This cape will flatter the curves of your backside, or the hump on your back.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Slait Nears
description:
They may be covered with furry rust, but these are the most aerodynamic ears you'll ever come across.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Siks Wonn Ein Cape
description:
Every Rassler knows the most dangerous part of rassling is the crowd. So when the chairs and bottles come flying into the ring, wrap this Pikoko fur cape around yourself and curl up into the foetal position.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Slugly Helmet
description:
This slimy, dripping helmet will nourish your scalp and keep your hair shiny, if not healthy. The two eyes attached to the top can be connected to your skull if you agree to have the nerve endings inserted into your ears.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Master Hunter's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Hammer Smithmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Shield Smith's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Costumagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Handyman's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: YeCh'Ti Amulet
description:
When your enemies see this amulet around your smooth, slender neck they'll think you're actually as hairy as the YeCh'Ti, which will frighten the living daylights out of them.
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Frost Cape
description:
Jon Lemon wore a similar cape during his famous concert in Brouce Boulgoure's Clearing. Those who weren't deafened still remember the concert's climax, when he stopped singing after becoming trapped in the ice because of his own cape.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Youllbea Mantle
description:
Goultard wore this mantle until he discovered the three sisters, when it was forgotten about in the back of an old cupboard.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Clementine Cape
description:
The cape, which releases a pleasant citrus aroma as you walk, will transform you into a powerful Moskito trap.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Grillian's Hat
description:
Grillian was a great magician. He is most famous for having reinventing the wheel, having forgotten how to manufacture them.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Paper Cape
description:
This cape is long enough for you to be able to afford to leave blank lines between each cribbed note you've made before you take that all-important, life-changing exam.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Paper Hat
description:
The tailor who made this hat had to use 12 powerful characteristic scrolls to craft it. Or possibly 12 sheets of toilet paper.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Borbacape
description:
This cloak with a ridiculous name is intriguing nonetheless, and belonged to a righteous man who claimed he wanted to clean up the streets of Brakmar. Nobody knows if he was a vigilante or a dustman.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Borbahat
description:
This hat will give you the allure of a Borbat. You're single at the moment, right? Yeah, you're going to stay single for quite a while.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Jon Lemon's Cape
description:
Jon Lemon loved this cape to death, which explains why he wears it to each of his funerals.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Blue Tofu
description:
They say blue Tofus do not exist. They say no one in this lifetime has ever seen one. Yet, on very cold mornings when mist still clings to the soles of your boots, you can sometimes find a blue feather amongst all the yellow in the squares in front of Tofu houses. The presence of this feather is considered a blessing, for the visit of the mysterious Blue Tofu is always a sign of joy, everlasting and bountiful.
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Elia Ring
description:
A strange ring, imitating a cube with unknown properties. Is it a thimble? A game die? A small chest? Nobody ever knew the answer. It was thought, probably wrongly, that it could be an imitation of an ancient, long-forgotten artefact whose shape could have survived the fashions, irrespective of its use. One reason for its success remains the welfare and assurance it provides its wearer, as if protected beyond time and space.
(Place this ring over another, already-equipped ring to change its appearance.)

name: Platypus Helmet
description:
This helmet is used by the hostesses of Osamodas temples to welcome new candidates to the annual competition of the best trainers in Astrub. The idea of using the Platypus as a mascot for the event came after the pet, known as being indomitable, was introduced to the masses. The trainer who can subdue the animal has definitely earned his stripes. So far, no one has succeeded, the animal preferring to choose its own master and do exactly whatever it wants. Holders of the cap believe themselves to be rebel elements of a theocratic society known for its rigidity.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Phoenix
description:
This pet can arise from its ashes by itself, just like a grown one.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Miss Amakna Amulet
description:
This amulet makes you living proof that you can take pride in your appearance even in this world of bloodthirsty brutes who wallow in the mud all day. Bet you feel just like Queen of the Lousy Pigs now…
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Mr. World of Twelve Amulet
description:
Your bulging muscles, your towering stature and your charisma have made you the World of Twelve's most gorgeous adventurer, and this amulet proves it. We all know that you were lucky not to have to sit an IQ test, though.
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Spacevader Staff
description:
It has been said that this staff is able to deal mortal blows which can destroy any invader with just one blow. Only a fool would fall for a thing like that.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Pongshovel
description:
The flat, strangely-shaped Pongshovel is one of the worst shovels you could hope for when it comes to digging. It does make a pretty good table tennis paddle, though.
(Place this shovel over another, already-equipped shovel to change its appearance.)

name: Pacmaggers
description:
For a long time, people believed that the Pacmaggers were throwing knives: their first users were scared the yellow ball that decorates their handles was going to gobble up their hands, which caused them to throw them instinctively. Nowadays, jumpy adventurers are banned from using them because of their unfair advantage over standard daggers.
(Place this daggers over another, already-equipped daggers to change its appearance.)

name: Survivor Shield
description:
You are one of the smallest mammals in the World to have witnessed Grozilla and Grasmera's extinction and the apocalypses which followed, and to have survived. With a bit of luck, you'll take a leaf out of your distant ancestors' book and set about evolving into something better now. I mean, you kind of need it.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Gladiastaff
description:
Adventurers who don't know what this strange staff with two round ends is for may assume it's for cleaning out a Trool's ears. That's not right though, it's exactly the right size for yours.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Scampiscuba Helmet
description:
Mix new technology with traditional methods and you end up with the Scampiscuba Helmet. This jazzed-up diving headgear will allow a Scampihorse to disappear down into the deepest, darkest depths of Sufokia for days on end for a little "alone time". As for you, you can use it as a scuba-diving mask, but please try to stay afloat. We wouldn't want to have to call the rescue team out again.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Stobbs Mask
description:
An elegant copper mask that will allow you to not only solder away to your heart's content, but also impress your friends with your metallic voice and blood-shot eyes. Try not to fall head over heels, you might just get a shock.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Guild Shield
description:
This magical shield reflects the soul of your guild.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Imakohat
description:
With this snug hat on your head, you feel as airy-fairy as a goddess of light. Of course, to everyone else, you just look like an albino Boowolf cub.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Wosungwee Shield
description: Some Wabbits say that the Wa starved his subjects, going so far as to pull Cawwots clean out of the jaws of hungry Tiwabbits. One day, the unhappy citizens rebelled and took up arms. This shield now symbolises their revolution. Of course, they hadn't realised just how cruel His Majesty Barf I could be. The rebellious rodents all ended up in a stew.

name: Tailblazer Shield
description:
This elegant shield will protect you from low blows, cutting remarks and rotten tomatoes. You can even use it as a scratching post!
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Alliance Shield
description:
This enchanted shield is imbued with the inimitable essence of your alliance.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Miss Triste Mask
description:
This mask may get you into the prestigious Miss Ugly contest, but you'll need something really special to win it! Most people just use theirs to hide their faces at parties they'd really rather not be at.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Adora Blazer
description:
This cape is carefully crafted to make hideous things look cute - for example, your ample rear end.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Geishawl
description:
This cape is mostly worn as a sign of affluence by artists and upper-class women. So it has nothing at all to do with those garish capes worn by the courtesans at Allister's Castle, understand?
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Geishax
description:
The lightness of this axe makes it pretty easy to use, even for frail women and geriatrics. But don't underestimate its razor-sharpness – more than a few overly-daring men have found their flames of passion permanently put out by it.
(Place this axe over another, already-equipped axe to change its appearance.)

name: Ninjammer
description:
Using a bladed weapon would mean running the risk of staining his clothes with your blood, so the White Ninja prefers blunt instruments, like this hammer. He may not like messes, but when he reaches for it, you're in for a world of hurt.
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Black Nincloak
description:
Black and White Ninjas have several things in common, one of them being this impressive garment. But as all experienced fighters will tell you: when you have to fight for your life, throw the cape away. How many adventurers have been killed in battle because they got their arms and legs trapped in their capes at a critical moment?
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Airmarmour
description:
Arthur Dint, illustrious voyager, used this shield at times as a fruit basket, and at other times as an umbrella. But with your knack for getting into trouble, you'll probably only have time to use it as a shield.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Pink Dragoomask
description:
They had to find a use for the Pink Dragoone's head once its dismembered corpse was turned into a cape. So for those who have wished they could show off their pet while riding a mount, your wish has been granted.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: 643 Champion Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Noh Mask
description:
Wearing this mask brings a horrible curse, causing the wearer to take on a new personality as long as the mask is upon his face. Counterfeits were used at times by Astrubians looking to justify their infantile behaviour, but their massive use near the Frigost Zaap alerted the authorities, who have put a definitive end to the fraud.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Capita
description:
This cape allows you to blend in with the crowd in urban areas without drawing the authorities' attention. What's more, it's big enough to hide all sorts of things, like lollipops, dolls, and even a small shepherd's crook.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Blimbonnet
description:
This hat may give your friends an irrepressible urge to rip your ears off. Luckily for you, your real ears will be well hidden under this hat.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Karnaval Cape
description:
Just like the matching headdress, it is suggested that you save this cape for special occasions. As much as you'd like to parade around a wedding reception with it on, you must admit that it's kind of rude to steal the bride's limelight so flagrantly.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Bworkler
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sweetheart Wings
description:
Love gives you wings, but singletons can always pretend with a pair of these strapped on.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Cake Topper
description:
Wherever you lay your hat, that's your cake.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Shusack
description:
This bag has a pretty good capacity, but it'd be best not to upset it. It's not unheard of to have certain items fall out the bottom of the Shusack, even if there's no hole anywhere in it. Oh, the joys of living with Shushus!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Meow Shield
description:
With this shield, you can run riot on walls that have just been painted. Knock yourself out!
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Mosk
description:
Bzzzzzz. Bzzzzzz. Bzz bzz. Bzzz? BZZZ!
(Change the appearance of the pet you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Flashy Shield
description:
Lightning usually only strikes once, but it's strangely attracted to this shield.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Traffic Shield
description:
With this shield, you can create traffic jams and send all the Dragoturkeys in the land on lengthy detours. Go on, you know you want to!
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Boney-O Staff
description:
You can throw this staff, fetch it and run around with it in your mouth until you're utterly lost.
(Change the appearance of the staff you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Radiant Shield
description:
This shield will adopt its wearer's colours, except when its wearer goes green at the gills.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Atanip Helmet
description:
With this helmet on your head, your enemies might finally believe you've got something in there.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Featheraxe
description:
The two feathers attached to this axe help it fly further when you throw it at an adversary.
(Change the appearance of the axe you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Featherguard
description:
The three feathers on this shield enable it to be used as a boomerang that never comes back.
(Change the appearance of the shield you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Featherhead
description:
With all these feathers on your head, only Piwis will look up to you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: XIV Staff
description:
This staff makes you feel positively regal. Maybe you'll start wearing a huge, extravagant wig and paint large suns on all the buildings in town. Heck, you can even leave the table whenever you want now!
(Change the appearance of the staff you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Al Howin's Sword
description:
This sword is more often used to scare people than to actually harm them, since the materials it is made from are largely harmless.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Insta Cape
description: Kevin was a painter who produced as many works in a year as Wa Wabbit had offspring. With success under his belt and wanting less stressful days, he contacted a sorcerer who knew how to put his talent up for auction. An old and unscrupulous book-face collector who was on the decline eventually bought it in exchange for this mass-produced cape.

name: Enutroid
description:
Who said that the Enutrofs were feeble old relics from a forgotten time? This hat is proof that they can be formidable opponents and ahead of their time. Nothing to do with haemorrhoids, mind.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Zalblaks Helmet
description:
The expression "to be pig-headed" makes so much more sense when you're wearing this helmet along with all the other Zalblaks supporters.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Monarch Staff
description:
This staff has the strange ability to make a trumpeting noise if you push on the end.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Joris's Cape
description:
"The first step in becoming a great hero is wearing a cape!"
That's the advice Joris got from a mysterious stranger, before leaving on his first adventures. So hurry up, put this cape on, and become a hero!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Julith's Cape
description:
A dark magic inhabits this cape: it seems to be linked to another dimension, giving it the appearance of a dark sky full of stars. But none who've seen its interior are still around to talk about it…
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Royal Guard Helmet
description:
This majestic Helmet is worn by the chief of Bonta's greatest soldiers: the Royal Guard. They exist to protect and serve the King of Bonta in all circumstances.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Flowery Summer Hat
description:
When placed on your head, this flower – which only blooms in summer – will always point you in the sun's direction.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: 646 Champion Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Shieltanuk
description: This shield is popular among bowlers at bowls championships. Thanks to its magical nature, it provides unparalleled protection against bad losers' inadvertent accidental throws.

name: Justice Shield
description:
Just like the judges of Amakna, here you are now, capable of making everyone believe that you deliver justice.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Cube
description:
It's hard to know if this creature is alive or whether it's an object inhabited by powerful magic. You won't get the answer by burning it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Dhrellthat
description:
In response to the Boarhog of the Enutrof Kitsous hunters, here's the Dhrellthat of Enutrof Bwork hunters. The contest for who's got the biggest petsmount isn't over yet.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Ush's Shield
description: This shield will have your opponents seeing red right before everything goes black.

name: Father Whupper Shield
description: Father Whupper smells as funky as a pair of old socks, and with this shield you'll be able to get your groove on too.

name: Magma Cloak
description:
Soft and always warm, this cloak is the perfect companion for soldiers when they are far from home.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Icky Bow Meow
description:
As sticky as the forehead of an Astrubian who's got acne.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Paunchy Boon
description:
The size of its stomach is proportional to that of your your ankles.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Zombite Shield
description:
This shield seems to have a mind of its own and it likes to become one with its owner. If you're in any doubt, just take a look at the necrosis running from your hand to your shoulder.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Ancient Sufokia Shield
description:
The motif on this shield is strangely reminiscent of the ones that can be found in the Eliotrope Temple at Sufokia.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Charming Godron
description:
This little dragon is able to melt anyone's heart – or a slab of butter – with its hot, silky breath.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Robust Helmet
description:
This helmet provides optimal protection for the skull, but diminishes the visual field considerably. If you're used to rushing in headlong, this helmet will become your best friend.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Melodious Cape
description:
The Melodious Cape is currently very fashionable with minstrels, because it lets you record a voice using its magic. Once recorded, you need to press different areas of the cape to create a melody from the voice. Purists debate using it, but you have to admit that it opens many interesting possibilities.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Crypt Cape
description:
The person who sold you this cape claimed to have acquired it from a wise old hermit who lived long ago, in a crypt where he meditated, far away from the stupidity of man. The hermit must have been truly wise and very brave to live in such deprivation and put up with the smell of urine, alcohol and dead animals that emanate from this cape.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Draeggosaure Cape
description:
Beautiful scales for a nicely rounded back.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Shiny Shield
description:
"What is dead cannot protect."
That's the motto of champions who keep their shields to defend themselves instead of giving them to their weaker allies.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Shiny Cape
description:
"It doesn't shine when it comes to intelligence."
This quotation could be used to describe this cape, as well as some of your closest friends.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Snailtri
description: From the icy lands of Frigost to the darkest alleys of Brakmar, the Snailtri is at every party. A faithful companion, it won't let you out of its sight. And when the going gets tough, it won't hesitate to rush and help you reach your goal.

name: Tal Kasha Shield
description: Before you took it from her, Tal Kasha used this shield as a mirror when she brushed her monstrous hair in the morning. There are even a few hairs still caught on it, and they scratched you when you tried to pull them off. Hair this aggressive is exceedingly rare.

name: Al Howin Gobtubby
description:
This Gobtubby is wearing a disguise out of solidarity with its Gobball friends, as Al Howin is a traumatic time for the fluffy creatures; they are forced to don silly Pumpkwin masks to try and scare Astrubians.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Protoz'orror Shield
description:
This shield, made from a piece of the Protoz'orror, has a very high bacterial contamination potential. Indeed, it represents the equivalent of tens of dirty tissues rolled into one, so your enemies had better use sanitising gel or any other disinfectant after hitting your shield, or they'll catch a cold that would make the most energetic of Trools lethargic.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Hairy Helmet
description:
This headgear is ideal for exploring the frozen lands of Kwismas Island, as the thickness of the hair stops the cold from getting through, and the glasses protect the eyes during snowstorms. But be careful that you're not mistaken for a Slayhound – a misguided hunter might inadvertently shoot at you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Advenkap
description:
Valiant adventurers know how to tout the advantages of this Advent cap to novices visiting Kwismas Island.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Az'Hassin Cloak
description:
Since you got this cloak, it regularly makes you want to jump from absurd heights just for fun. Provided there is a cart full of straw below, you can survive the fall. This may sound strange, but you will be surprised at the number of straw-filled carts below just about every high spot from where you might want to jump. Looks like they were put there deliberately…
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Esspeakewlair Cloak
description:
Romulu Ceremu had a habit of wearing this cloak with a small purple skirt and large sandal-boots. Strangely enough, this habit has disappeared, and people wear only the cloak now.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Saint Bonnetwine
description:
The two antennae situated on top of this hat have the peculiarity of releasing powerful seduction pheromones into the air when they are tossed around. In order to charm the one you love, you'll therefore have to shake your head vigorously to release these pheromones. Despite their effectiveness, it's quite likely you'll just look like an idiot. Using this helmet is not necessarily the best way to seduce people.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Monkiki'Ng Shield
description:
Under its appearance as a mere shield, there is actually a teasing, malicious demon who will exploit your enemies' sensitivities. A master in the art of grimacing, he will give your opponent a compendium of extremely annoying facial expressions. Unfortunately for your opponents, no one can try and beat him at this little game, because you can't teach an old shield new faces.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Prez' Doh'blik
description:
The label attached to the back of the Prez' says "from Auntie Nielleda". Better let it follow you than risk opening it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Prez' Doh'bstruktion
description:
The label attached to the back of the Prez' says "from Auntie Nielleda". Better let it follow you than risk opening it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Rikoh
description:
When he was still an infant, Rikoh got bitten by a Khamelerost, which gave him the amazing ability to change colour at will. It turns out he's attached himself to you, and he's changing colour to suit your outfit. So be careful, because if you're one of those people who dresses any old how, you'll both be matching, but doubly ridiculous.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Shadragon Helmet
description:
A fierce jawline, sharp fangs, made out of the darkest black metal edged with gold, glowing eyes under scaly eyebrows – this full-face helmet has all the bells and whistles if you want to make an impression. It is, shall we say, not very practical if you want to pick your nose, cough, sneeze, or even throw up.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Rafal
description:
Not all dragons are creatures of legend and creators of Dofus with unparalleled powers. Some are much smaller and weaker, but they've been able to exploit their metamorphic abilities to perfection to trick gullible adventurers. Many of these adventurers do not see through the trickery and are all too happy to parade about with what they believe to be a primordial dragon at their heels, letting them sponge off them.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Brial
description:
Not all dragons are creatures of legend and creators of Dofus with unparalleled powers. Some are much smaller and weaker, but they've been able to exploit their metamorphic abilities to perfection to trick gullible adventurers. Many of these adventurers do not see through the trickery and are all too happy to parade about with what they believe to be a primordial dragon at their heels, letting them sponge off them.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Kourial
description:
Not all dragons are creatures of legend and creators of Dofus with unparalleled powers. Some are much smaller and weaker, but they've been able to exploit their metamorphic abilities to perfection to trick gullible adventurers. Many of these adventurers do not see through the trickery and are all too happy to parade about with what they believe to be a primordial dragon at their heels, letting them sponge off them.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Hyrkul Helmet
description:
This helmet may very well be thick and solid, but it won't stop experienced mind-readers from penetrating your brain. It is, however, the ideal accessory to protect you from falling objects on high-risk construction sites, and to protect you should you fall on your head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Wa Odanowth's Cwown
description:
Every year on 6 Javian, Twelvians come together to eat the famous Thwee Kings Cake. This tradition has been adapted from Wabbit customs, consisting of hiding this crown somewhere in the world. Whoever manages to find it earns the right to wear it and is named "Wa Odanowth" for the celebration.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Glomerys
description:
This pet rolls itself up into a ball whenever it senses any danger, which makes it the perfect enemy detector. If it's never relaxed and unrolled in your presence, you might want to take a long look in the mirror.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Anakronik Pack
description:
It seems that this backpack carries the answer to an ultimate question that hasn't been asked yet.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Jar-Jar Bag
description:
A glass container full of mess at all times.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Daffodield
description:
If you think fighting with style and grace is impossible, you've never given this shield a try. That said, remember to water it every day or you'll start to look a bit wilted.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Sram Headgear
description:
Wearing this headgear is very popular among Sssram's disciples, but there are consssequences. Wearing this headgear will make you whistle when you speak, which may annoy everyone around you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Sram Cape
description:
Srams hide all sorts of traps and other snares under their capes, and the few visible snags are irrefutable proof of this.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Dream Wings
description:
Every night you hope and pray that dream wings will come your way, wings to flap instead of arms, so you can know the magic of their charms.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Osamodas Headgear
description:
The bestial god's horns are very popular among fans of assault and battery. On both the giving and receiving end. No judgement here.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Nightmare Horns
description:
The most wicked nightmares use these horns to jab sleeping dreamers on the bum. Now they're yours, you can play a nasty trick on your friends, who will have a good laugh once they've stopped screaming.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Boockler
description:
This shield doesn't look scary at first glance. But its being transparent may explain why some people are startled to see you.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Cra Cape
description:
The quality of one's appearance is often found in the details. With this cape, you're certain not to make a mess of it.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Cra Shoulder Pads
description:
These shoulder pads are rare and highly prized pieces that give whoever wears them unrivalled elegance.
(Place these shoulder pads over an already-equipped shield to change their appearance.)

name: Wild Shield
description:
The best defence is a good offence. But a furry shield to push back attacks isn't half bad.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Ominous Cloak
description:
The darkness of this cloak reveals a fateful omen, especially for anyone that dares to attack its wearer.
(Place this cloak over another, already-equipped cloak to change its appearance.)

name: Vanelle Sings Hat
description:
Every good vampire hunter needs this hat, even if it's just to make it look like they hunt vampires seriously.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Fantastic Dreamshield
description: Fantasy is a concept quite foreign to this shield, although its origins lie on the edges of reality.

name: Infinite Dreamsield
description: This shield will take you to infinity and beyond.

name: Star Dreamshield
description: This shield is rare and likes that fact to be known. So don't get it dirty, or you'll be sorry.

name: Little Moushu Cape
description:
There's no point sinking your milk teeth into the back of this cape – you've got the wrong legend.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Last Hope Shield
description:
When woe has conquered the heart of time, this shield will illuminate the path for those fighting to save it.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Servitude Bow Wow
description:
The trail of slobber behind this watchdog can be a formidable weapon if used properly, and will show off your pilot skills. However, it makes it extremely easy to follow your trail.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Sramscot
description:
Follow this pet's advice and you, too, will become an expert in the art of outfoxing your opponents.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Osamscot
description:
This pet's suckers, pointy tongue and long tail make this pet the perfect companion for masked parties in the depths of the Osamodas Temple.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Sadida Headgear
description:
Since Masqueraiders have surpassed Sadidas when it comes to masks, those nature lovers have sought out other attributes to set themselves apart. With this headgear, you might say they've succeeded.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Sadida Cape
description:
"Make do with what you have," or so says a wise Sadida tailor.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Bamboockler
description:
Make sure you keep this shield with you for the day you no longer feel like holding out an olive branch to everyone you meet. It is very easy to wield, which will help with your defence.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Megacape
description:
This cape used to belong to a famous hero who was famous for confronting the terrible Doctor Wily. This beast wanted to invade and dominate the World of Twelve with his army of summoned creatures. The good Doctor died before his minions had finished eating what he called "the last supper".
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Champion Boots
description:
Some adventurers say these boots allow you to walk on traps without activating them. But be careful, as that might be a trap in itself…
(Place these boots over a pair of already-equipped boots to change their appearance.)

name: Coney Cap
description:
Who would dare wear such a ridiculous cap? No one, if not you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: The HmmMmmmMmmm
description:
Mmmmm mm mmmmmm mmmmm, mmm mmm mm mmmmmm mmmmm mmmmmmm mmmmmm mmm mmmm'm mmmmm mmmm mmmmmmm.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Galgarion's Helmet
description:
In spite of appearances, this helmet won't help your hearing. It'll help you see farther, though. Just watch out for any strong winds or you'll be blown away like a little feather.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Beanie Cape
description:
Made from enormous coffee beans, this cape smells like a Pikoko's armpit. It really gets the blood flowing before a battle… and it's cheap, too.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Lemon Hat
description:
Your head will easily fit this humongous emptied lemon and the little pip inside it will feel at home!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Bobbl'Hat
description:
This hat smells of Demonic Roses which should rid you off your lice, and any other form of parasites that squats your head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Caposh
description:
With such a nice target sewn upon your cape, your enemies will have no excuse for missing you.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Poshield
description:
The pin nailed into this shield can be used as an extra-close combat weapon and kill your enemies.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Boh-Bihn Shield
description:
When Iops get stars from their teachers for good work, they stick them to this shield. From time to time, they would stick them all over themselves to show off in front of their classmates.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Alowa Headband
description:
This headband is perfect to absorb perspiration or to display your "Alowa Attitude".
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Solaris Mask
description:
This mask will capture the sunlight and concentrate it on your face so you can stay nice and brown all year round, even if you live to the north of Amakna.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Lamechester United Shield
description:
This imposing shield perfectly sums up today's youth: style over substance – all bark, and no bite. It'd be good for nothing in a real fight, unless your opponent was coming at you with a ball.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Grozillamulet
description:
You won this amulet thanks to your incomparable capacity for breaking eggs without making an omelette.
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Master Lumberjack's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Bow Carver's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Jeweller's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Baker's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Tailor's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Axe Smith's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Fisherman's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Shovel Smithmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Fishmonger's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: The Black Crow's Piercing Lance
description:
It may have taken you a while, but here it is, in your hands at last: the Black Crow's sword…
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Feather Cape
description:
This huge feather cape accentuates your figure.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Prisoner Cape
description:
The striped cape belonged to a prisoner famous for his predicament.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Prisoner Hat
description:
This striped hat is big enough to hide a skull, especially if it's numb.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Jon Lemon's Hat
description:
This old hat is bordering on the ridiculous, and it's how Jon Lemon earned the nickname "The Moustachioed Grandmother". That name tends to put him in a bad mood.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Jon Lemon's Blowpipe
description:
Jon Lemon should never have used this blowpipe just after eating. Since that day he's had to use it as a simple staff and as he so often repeats, "it was better before".
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Percimol's Cape
description:
This cape perfectly illustrates Percimol's favourite saying: React, resist, and never relinquish!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Percimol's Hammer
description:
This hammer, which is as heavy as the atmosphere generated when Rattedauge tells one of his "jokes", is perfect for crushing the Minotoror's hooves. It is equally effective should you wish to smash other, just-as-sensitive body parts.
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Apprentice Cloak
description:
Working as an apprentice is no picnic, but it lets you progress faster than theory-based lessons, especially when your employer is the most famous alchemist around.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Pandalida Headband
description:
This pretty headband will make you look like a right diva. It won't do much for your masculinity either.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pandalida Staff
description:
Nobody ever taught Pandalida the art of war. She taught herself everything she knew. The way she held her staff, in particular, was very unconventional. She would point it at her mouth and scream from the top of her lungs. This quickly earned her the reputation of being one of the most monstrous killers of her time.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Davyd's Scythe
description:
A great music lover, Davyd's bow is easily transported because it's attached to his scythe, which vibrates every time he shakes it. During the time it took to perfect his skill with this rare instrument, he managed to send all the other farmers running for the hills, meaning he now owns all the wheat fields in Amakna and his fortune is guaranteed.
(Place this scythe over another, already-equipped scythe to change its appearance.)

name: 641 Champion Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Clomane
description:
This long, soft and colourful mane, decorated with its pink flower bow, will attract the fervour and caresses of all the ladies in the World of Twelve. If you're one of them, that is. If you're a man, it will just remove your virility and remove you from your position as the alpha male. Forever.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Wicked Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Maria Kitty's Hammegaphone
description:
Every day, Maria Kitty does her singing exercises on the bridge of her ice prisoner boat, the Emancipation of Me, using her Hammegaphone. Little does she know, that's what keeps her safe from the region's monsters: the sound of Maria's amplified voice is so unbearable that all living creatures for kilokametres around run away and never come back. Only her husband, Nick Annon, stays. He's been deaf for quite a while, though.
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Maria Kitty's Cape
description:
If little Maria from Frigost managed to appeal to a huge audience and make a name for herself right across the Amaknian continent, you can bet it was this cape that got her noticed. Anyone who wears it on their shoulders will make a real spectacle of themselves and Maria always played sell-out shows. Don't hope for too much when you put it on though, the public's not stupid enough to fall for it twice.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Mini-Mr. Amakna Amulet
description:
So… You've faced hundreds of hours of tortuous gym workouts. You've weight trained and fake tanned like your life depended on it. You've downed a raw egg milkshake every day, even on Kwismas… and you've been voted one of the hunks of your generation. Let's hope it was worth it!
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Neon Cloak
description:
This cloak is the ideal garment for a late night. It'll keep you buzzing into the early hours and will probably send your enemies raving mad.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Wee Willie Wincap
description: This hat will make you want to run through the town in your nightwear. For the crazy, lazy fool that you are, that doesn't change much, so why not try putting it on your head when facing adversaries?

name: Bussinpoots Hat
description:
Nobody's figured out why, but when small, ginger, chubby, whiskered, very hairy adventurers with abnormally large pupils and funny accents put on this hat, they suddenly change in the eyes of women from the "definitely do not approach under any circumstances" type to the "aww can I stroke it?" type. Wonders never cease!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: 642 Champion Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Krosmahat
description:
This hat will allow you to hide your biggest secret: that you too have a 'super-deformed' head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Krosmacloak
description:
This cape was specially designed to hide the flabby builder's bum that peeps out of your trousers when you bend over to pick stray kamas off the ground.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Brrrito Shield
description:
This giant snout may not increase your sense of smell, but its tusks will help you ward off approaching danger.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Chromulet
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Darkshield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Just Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Miss Triste Cloak
description:
This cloak was designed to help Miss Triste win the Miss Amakna contest. You can probably guess how that one finished.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Maskomen Tengu
description:
This mask not only makes you seem more fierce than you actually are, but it also hides your terrifying face. Two advantages for the price of one!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Staffomen Tengu
description:
This staff is useful for knocking hecklers around during a performance. It's also quite good for squishing the Arachnees and Moskitos who always come, uninvited, to gate-crash your performances.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Adora Bicorn
description:
This hat might look a little silly on its own, but coupled with the rest of the set, its generous curves will make you Astrub's heart-throb.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Adora Blades
description:
You won't think these daggers are quite as cute when they rip slowly through your flesh all the way down to the bone.
(Place this daggers over another, already-equipped daggers to change its appearance.)

name: Black Quakane
description:
Originally, this staff was immaculate; it picked up its permanent black tint by being repeatedly thrust into the nooks and crannies of Bwork dungeons… and of the Bworks themselves…
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: White Nincloak
description:
The White Ninja is a stickler for appearances, which is why he always wears this magnificent white cape and takes great pains to keep it clean. It's also why the Black Ninja never misses an opportunity to stain it.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Ninjaxe
description:
Flat broke, the Black Ninja had to trade away his sharp blades for some food and a hatchet sharp enough to cut to the quick. All he has to do is aim for his target's neck.
(Place this axe over another, already-equipped axe to change its appearance.)

name: Makatana
description:
We're not quite sure what the blacksmith was trying to do when he made this sword, but we're pretty sure he was hungry.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Domesticloak
description:
Wearing this cape feeds so many fantasies that some eccentric enchanters are trying to make a food out of it. They claim that if they succeed, they'll be able to satisfy all the Word of Twelve for at least ten generations.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Samurai Helmet
description:
Besides hiding your natural baldness, this helmet will make you look like a fearsome warrior. But keep in mind, if you feel like fighting, that your martial arts skills are still non-existent.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Coronita
description:
This headband is worn low in the front, in order to cover the ears. This makes it look a little less unfashionable, and more importantly, helps to keep your ears warm when the cold winds blow.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Sweetheart Crown
description:
With this crown on your head, you'll be King Casanova! Even the Gobballs will be falling at your feet!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Dorsal Cap
description:
Now that you've got the hat for it, you can't wait to start hanging out in the shallow water near the beach to frighten the tourists. You just hope none of them will take it as a challenge and try to attack you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Kamabag
description:
One kama can hide another. If a bandit tries to grab the fake kama sticking out of the top of this bag, he'll be disappointed… But it won't stop him from slashing the side of the bag to steal all your real treasures!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Greenengol Helmet
description:
Proudly show your belief in the Greenengol by wearing this helmet. Or you could grab some pompoms and start screaming the name of your team, but that might be embarrassing.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Flashy Sword
description:
Even if your next sword flail totally misses your enemy, at least you'll look electro-cute. Teehee!
(Change the appearance of the sword you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Radiant Cloak
description:
This cloak will adopt its wearer's colours, except when its wearer goes green with envy.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Goba Vett
description:
Evolved from the fabled Gobsteed and distant cousin to the notorious Gobbal'N' Go, this beast moves at such a clip you'll have to hold on tight to its horns so you don't fall off.
(Change the appearance of the petsmount you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Droid Bow
description:
This is not the bow you're looking for.
(Change the appearance of the bow you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Raja Shield
description:
This shield looks like a target and will attract arrows from archers high and low. Give it to your worst enemy as a present.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Raja Headgear
description:
This headgear is just what you needed to hide your big head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Radiant Headgear
description:
This hat will adopt its wearer's colours, except when its wearer is beaten black and blue.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Atanip Wand
description:
People say that whacking your enemies' heads with this wand will make toys and sweets appear. Finally a little innocent fun in this violent world!
(Change the appearance of the wand you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Atanip Cloak
description:
If you manage to roll yourself up in this cloak, someone might think you're a nice surprise.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Crossbone Headgear
description:
You could use this thing as a shield, if only it wasn't fitted with hair gel dispensers all over.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Featherback
description:
The feathers on this cloak will slow down your fall when you slip out of bed in the night.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Sourachnee
description:
It's almost always in a bad mood, but then again, so are you.
(Change the appearance of the petsmount you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: XIV Shield
description:
This wax shield is just what you've always wanted for making moulds of your enemies' faces.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: XIV Headgear
description:
This is the undisputed palace of lice, fleas and ticks. Probably because it's so comfortable and smells like testosterone.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Gingerbread Hat
description:
The delectable smell and savoury look of this hat are two reasons to wear it during the holiday season. Put it on, and all eyes will be on you. Just make sure people don't mistake you for dessert!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Kwismas Sack
description:
When Father Kwismas climbs down the chimneys in Amakna, he usually leaves a lot of gifts for young adventures with big dreams. This time, he left you his sack – maybe so you can bring some Kwismas magic of your own to the World of Twelve…
(Place this backpack over other, already-equipped backpack to change its appearance.)

name: Springy Hat
description:
This hat offers protection against bad weather. It should therefore be worn if you are in a stormy relationship and you keep getting the cold shoulder from your significant other.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Gunsen Shield
description:
More than just protection, this shield has a simple and refined aesthetic which allows you to cool yourself off on very hot days.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Kokokohat
description:
There's nothing better than a kokoko-strengthened helmet to protect your pretty little head against your enemies' kokolossal blows.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Cloakscreen
description:
Ideal for slipping through the jungle unseen, this cloak will help you conceal your little mischiefs, like weeing on your neighbour's letter box.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: 1001 Claws Tail
description:
Some say you need a tail to wear this piece of armour, while others say it's only ceremonial. Anyone who's seen Kerub use it can tell you it's possible to be both extremely classy and extremely deadly at the same time.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: 1001 Claws Helmet
description:
Many proud warriors have tried to wear this helmet in pursuit of its power, but in vain as it only confers its power on someone whose head can fill it completely. So far only Kerub has succeeded, which has made him the legend we all know. Will you manage to take his place?
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Tactile Helmet
description:
No one will recognise you under this colourful helmet! Now you're a formidable but irresistibly cute soldier, to the point that everyone will want to poke you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pamus Shield
description:
This blue and white-striped shield is the symbol of the Pamus. Wave it proudly so everyone will know which team you support!
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Zalblaks Shield
description:
It's traditional for Zalblaks to brandish the twisted face painted on their equipment while shouting unintelligible lyrics in order to scare their enemies and lead them to victory.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Pynal Cape
description:
Both warm and prickly at the same time, this cape lets you collect loads of Kwismas gifts that aren't intended for you, all the while passing you off as a Pricky.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: 1001 Claws Nunchaku
description:
If you doubt their power, know that these Nunchaku have left scars on even the most redoubtable beings in the World of Twelve. That shut you up, didn't it?
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Dragorace Headgear
description: Wearing the decapitated head of a mount that lost a race as headgear is indeed a little sadistic… but it is also very effective for motivating your mounts. (Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Royal Tofu Shield
description: Made from a feather you plucked from a Royal Tofu, this shield is thought to be one of the most resistant in the world. As the proverb goes, "The sword is mightier than the feather…"

name: Skeunkield
description: Grand champion of Saint Ballotwine, Skeunk uses his instrument to seduce everyone who comes into his field of vision.
