Unfortunately for him, you didn't fall for his serenade, and you smashed him to bits. Now you're in possession of his beautiful harp – adorned with the scalp of victory – which you use as a shield.

name: Kimbo Shield
description:
The following inscription can be read on the back of this shield:
"Kimbo in summer;
The challenge for combatants,
A fearless winner."

name: Royal Rainbow Blop Shield
description: In the colours of the rainbow, this shield looks more like confectionery than protective item.

name: Katar's Shield
description:
This shield is more useful for tearing your enemies to shreds during a bloody charge than for protecting you.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Drhellakna
description:
Tired of regularly getting extorted while crossing Cania, Amaknean merchants have financed the raising of hard-shelled Drhellers. For now, they are delivered as a kit with the Drheller on one side and its armour on the other, but Otomai's Disciples are working to merge the two into one species.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Drhellilax
description:
Hot like fire and cruel like a nursery school teacher, the Drhellilax burns with desire to wreck everything in its path.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Mantiscore Shield
description: The Mantiscore uses a similar shield to defend itself from adventurers who are in too much of a hurry to make it rise to the bait.

name: Magma Shield
description:
Forged in the heart of a volcano, this shield offers weak protection against your opponents' insults. It is, however, highly effective at making their spray of spit evaporate before it reaches you.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Jumbow Meow
description:
This giant Bow Meow would be a very good petsmount if it didn't sleep twenty-three hours a day.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Charming Tofu
description:
It's difficult to resist it when it wiggles its little behind while cooing each time you go to pet it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Charming Boon
description:
It's difficult to resist it when it wiggles its little behind while cooing each time you go to pet it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Bontarian Boon
description:
This pet can look after a house while its master is away, but it's also capable of destroying it if its master doesn't come back quickly enough.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Zombite Headgear
description:
This hat gives off such an awful smell that it's hard to know whether your head smells like your feet or your feet smell like your head. At least you have a choice.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Nimaltocape
description:
Just like Mishell, this cape is soft and protective. All cute little animals are drawn to it, and they love to snuggle up inside. This isn't going to do much good for your reputation as a warrior with a heart of stone.
(Place this cape over another, already equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Green Ninja Nunchakus
description:
The first thing you did when you got your hands on these nunchakus was to imagine yourself doing all sorts of windmills and figures-of-eight to impress your enemies. It's only after months of training and multiple facial and groin injuries that you realised that there's more to the mastery of this weapon than meets the eye (and groin). Becoming a ninja isn't all that easy.
(Place this staff over another, already equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Green Ninja Pizzashield
description:
This shield, made from a hot Margorito pizza, won't protect you from blows, but you can still throw it at your enemy's feet to distract them while you run away like the little coward you are.
(Place this shield over another, already equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Divine Shield
description:
As soon as you say the word "divine", people can't help but answer "whine". Either this word has some link with the gods that you've failed to grasp, or your entourage has a really poor sense of humour.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Primordial Blacksmith's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Scarab Cape
description: I wouldn't expect to have much success when you spread the wings of this cape, if I were you. Not unless you're hoping to seduce eager Scaraleaves nearby.

name: Sewn Shield
description:
This shield is made from many magical threads, whose colours change depending on the bearer's mood and health. When they're fighting fit, the shield is solid and radiant. On the other hand, if ever you should suffer from nasty stomachache or gangrene, for example, avoid holding it, because nobody wants to see that.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Dracolyte
description:
Dracolytes are loyal and affectionate animals who will follow you everywhere. True, they don't have the stature of a real dragon, nor even of a Dreggon, but they can spit modest flames and cook small amounts of food to perfection! This may appear futile, but how many have perished because they neglected good cooking at a critical moment?
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Temporis I Mask
description: Time seems to have no effect on you. You haven't lost any of your youthful immaturity.

name: Temporis I Cloak
description: Gone, awning, with the wind.

name: Komet
description:
A lover of Goblimps' warped sense of humour, Komet was charmed by your own. This prompted him to leave the snowy forests of Kwismas Island so he could accompany you on rousing adventures.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Corsair Shield
description:
This shield was designed specially to resist cannonballs, and thereby protect its bearer during naval battles. Make sure to read the fine print, though: "Only works if you have prodigious strength." So, make sure you build up as much muscle as you can before your next battle.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Peki Peki Shield
description:
Some people choose to decorate their shield with the head of a lion, a dragon, or a griffin as a symbol of power and majesty, but you've chosen a shield with the head of a stupid dog.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Esspeakewlair Shield
description:
Romulu Ceremu regularly organised warriors' games to entertain his soldiers in peacetime, the DeeDubYuess. Fans could proudly wear the symbols of their favourite teams on their shields to support them in these contests.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Waurice Maleffe's Diadem
description:
Waurice Maleffe was an aesthete, fascinated by beauty in general, and especially by that of people. One day, he came up with the idea of making a beautiful diadem that he would offer to the most beautiful person he would meet in his life. But his quest never came to an end, for there was always some more beautiful person to discover, and he ended up losing his mind in search of ultimate beauty. Waurice must be turning in his grave knowing that his diadem is on your head. You may not be the most beautiful person in the world, but at least you're not crazy or dead.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Aispik
description:
Aispiks are of a very discreet nature. The icy peaks covering their skin allow them to camouflage themselves effectively in snow-covered lands. Paradoxically, it's also this ability that led to their discovery, when an unfortunate adventurer sat on what he thought was "a comfortable little pile of snow".
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Hesk
description:
This Slayhound has the ability to adapt the colour of its fur to the colours of its rider.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Shadragon Shield
description:
This shield, made from black dragon scales, might make you think of a charred skull. If you could spit fire, it would be brilliantly threatening to your enemies.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Salar
description:
Not all dragons are creatures of legend and creators of Dofus with unparalleled powers. Some are much smaller and weaker, but they've been able to exploit their metamorphic abilities to perfection to trick gullible adventurers. Many of these adventurers do not see through the trickery and are all too happy to parade about with what they believe to be a primordial dragon at their heels, letting them sponge off them.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Wingepig
description: Burning with desire to escape from Minotoror Island, the Wingepig's tiny wings took it too close to the sun. Ever since that day, adventurers the world over have been drooling over its perfectly grilled back.

name: Bigxine
description:
It's like a Noxine but much more: more feet, more light, more patterns, more sound, etc.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Hats Off Ta Ya Hat
description:
Magical hats are named after the first words said to them. I'm sure you can already imagine the look on the hatter's face when her apprentice commented on her work.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Weeov Hat
description:
A wee oven to keep your wee head warm.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Fleaster Cape
description:
Fleaster falls on the first Sunday after the first full moon following 21 Martalo, so on 22 Martalo at earliest, if the full moon falls on the evening of the 21st, and on 25 Aperirel at latest. This does not mean the moon as it is seen, but rather the "Fleastal" moon, calculated using an inexact but traditional method. The "civilised" peoples of the World of Twelve – having adopted both the Grougorian calendar reform and a concurrent correction for the lunar cycle – often celebrate on a different day than the "primitive" peoples, and the discrepancy can be either nothing, or one or five weeks (depending on the year), or exceptionally four weeks if there is a new moon in Bonta but not in Brakmar.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Musical Ring
description:
When you wear this ring, people can hear you coming long before you arrive. Slip it on your finger and you'll feel an irresistible urge to sing.
(Place this ring over another, already-equipped ring to change its appearance.)

name: Tylezia Cape
description:
This cape is reminiscent of a dragon's mane and gives you a refined air whenever you want.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: LeChouque's Shield
description:
The good thing about being thick in the middle is that it offers some protection against blows, but not as much as this shield.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Daggero Shield
description:
After a fun dungeon, there's nothing like a glass of bamboo milk and a new shield before jumping back into the fray.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Vici Shield
description:
Bearing this shield is a not-at-all discreet way of showing the world you're a conqueror.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Primate Satchel
description:
The tail attached to this bag will give you an animal look, but be careful not to step on it…
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Primate Shield
description:
The wood of this shield comes straight from Moon's tree, making it extremely robust while remaining light and easy to handle.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Khin-Tohoun
description:
Now, not only can have your head in the clouds whenever you want, you can also soar wherever you go!
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Nightmare Eye
description:
It is said that if the eye on this shield were to open, whosoever should meet its gaze would fall into a dreamlike limbo for eternity and go completely mad. Just in case the legend is true, keep it facing your enemies.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Foggernaut Headgear
description:
Legend has it that the creator of this headgear dreamt of becoming a Unikron, which partly explains the gaping hole in the front of this crownlike piece. The myth was tested, but researchers only got sunburn on their foreheads for their trouble.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Foggernaut Shield
description:
This technological jewel shaped like Oktapodas features six golden, rust-resistant tentacles designed to withstand all kinds of damage. From the front and the back, this high-quality item won't let you down. Only one recommendation on use: remember to protect yourself!
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Wild Headband
description:
This strap of leather adorned with bones and fur will give you an animal air and terrify your prey.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Misty Dreamshield
description: Fortunately, this shield is much stronger than its name suggests. Its bright colours will also allow you to blind your enemies.

name: Scrabrrrt Ring
description: No one knows how long he's been locked in his ice cube, but one thing is for sure, he could put the whole world at risk if anyone touches his acorn.

name: Pandowla
description:
Forget space. Forget time. Ride Pandowla and experience legends before they're written.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Last Hope Hood
description:
The message this hood conveys is not to fight with your face covered, but to fight with an open heart.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Soft Oak Shield
description:
This shield saved a Stubbyob prince's life when he faced an albino Bwork. It may save yours when you face your in-laws.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Nekineko Bag
description:
Wherever you go with this bag bearing the effigy of Nekineko, don't be surprised if you get followed around by a crowd of Enutrofs.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Wa Odanowth's Cloak
description:
Some tradition-bound Twelvians thought it was forbidden to wear anything other than the Wa Odanowth's Cwown when it was Thwee Kings Cake time. So they wouldn't catch a cold, they voted for the right to wear other attire worthy of a Wa during the event, such as this marvellous cloak.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Feca Shield
description:
The culmination of Feca art, this shield is indestructible and a source of eternal pride for its designers. Its refined colours are a treat for the eyes, too.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Griffined Shield
description:
You figured that with a griffin on your arm, you'd outshine every falconer everywhere. But no, alas. If you'd bothered to look at the inscription inside the shield, you'd have seen "VBMR - Secondary Wheel". VBMR probably stands for "very best magnetic roundel" but you're still wondering what that could possibly have to do with flying beasts.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Iopscot
description:
True believers in their god's precepts, Iopscot pets are always quick to charge head first into close combat.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Roguscot
description:
Thanks to this ingenious pet, you'll have the perfect alibi and be at the inn when the militia building explodes.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Silver Escuktaeon
description:
This coat of arms rewards the spectacular feats of the best fighters from among the ordinary rank and file. This gives them a place of pride in all the inns in the World of Twelve.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Sacrier Cape
description:
Created from the instruments of torture used on a Sacrier, this cape is soaked in the blood from their injuries. The Crobak whose wings were ripped off to adorn this cape in the honour of the goddess was mistreated in proper form and then released back into nature.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Sacrier Shield
description:
Too heavy to be worn around the neck, this necklace is worn on the forearm like a shield. It doesn't protect the wearer one bit, but that doesn't seem to bother Sacriers in the slightest.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Astrowig
description:
You'll have the perfect hairdo with the Astrowig.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Bunny Ears
description:
These ears will accentuate your bright smile and get the opposite sex spreading rumours about you.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Winter Cloak
description:
A pretty, warm, powerfully smelling lining was sewn beautifully onto an ordinary cape.
Around your shoulders, or lain in front of a roaring fire like a Gobball-skin rug, you'll find some use for this cape. Eventually.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Champion Helmet
description:
With this imposing helmet, you'll become big-headed for sure, if you aren't already!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Mini Champion
description:
This small creature only follows champions… You might get a few days out of it before it realises you're a hopeless imposter. From then on, you'll be wearing the leash.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Tipsy Top Hat
description:
There was an unbeatable Cra, who performed all attacks from afar. He thought it quite strange, when the Neye stole his range, and his hits became very sub par!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Cra's Burnt Headgear
description:
This headgear is perfect for Cras who don't mind looking average. Careful though, you will look very silly, stupid even. Usually this headgear is given to retired combatants who've lost a good portion of their brain cells.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pym's Blade
description:
This blade was stolen from a smith's shop window where it had laid for many years. Let's hope it sees more use in your hands than it did with its previous owner! If not, it's not going to be much good unless you open your own shop.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Beanie Hat
description:
Pop in two sugars, give it a quick stir, and quench your thirst with this revitalising hat. Sugar sold separately.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Hamm'Ornet
description:
The little wings attached to this hammer make it lighter and easier to handle… It can even fly on its own and hit you on the head while you're sleeping. Hilarious.
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Citrus Cape
description:
This cape was made from the peels of lots of different citrus fruits. It's a pretty, refreshing cape, but unfortunately it doesn't glow in the dark.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Crystalline Hat
description:
The next barber who tries to give you a haircut will be lucky not to break their comb.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Bobblecape
description:
If you think your backside never had the attention it deserved, just put on this long cape which will dress it up and catch everyone's attention.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Shield Kada
description:
If you don't want to scare your friends away with your ugly face, just hide it behind this nice, welcoming shield.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: The Godfather's Fedora
description:
This special hat will make you look like the Godfather. You should be proud!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Raydi Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Newddha the Prophet's Backpack
description:
Newddha the Prophet is famous for renouncing his family's wealth and sitting under a Kokonut tree, waiting for enlightenment to dawn upon him. Instead, a giant Kokonut cracked him on the head, leading him to leave all that spiritual nonsense behind for good.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Hispañic Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Unique Hispañic Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Solaris Shield
description:
This shield will reflect the sun right into the eyes of your opponent. Instead of dazzling them with your blinding wit, blind them instead with this dazzling shi…eld.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Benji's Helmet
description:
It's the integrated red sunglasses that make this the helmet of choice for any self-respecting Lamechester United player.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Scale Shield
description:
Fashioned from one of Grozilla's scales, this is a heavy shield of exceptional stature. Only rare and fearsome fighters may proudly wear it.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Master Sword Smith's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Hammer Smith's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Wand Carver's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Alchemist's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Sword Smithmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Staff Carvmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Master Jewelmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: The Black Crow's Helmet
description:
You can't hide; you've been unmasked! So, the Black Crow is you after all! You would have gotten away with it too, if it weren't for those meddling kids!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pynekone Hat
description:
Padded with Bow Meow hair and covered with bark, this hat is extremely flammable. You should not sit on it if your pants are on fire.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Pynekone Cape
description:
In hot weather, this cape's scales spread open to help your sweat evaporate. When it rains, this cape's scales spread open to let the rain in and rinse your posterior.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Lonne's Hammer
description:
When it comes to sounding out his opponents, Lonne Jenone has more than one string to his fiddle – he uses it as a hammer. One thing is certain: sparks will fly!
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Lonne's Cape
description:
This leather cape, though light, will accompany you on all your incredible rides on the back of a Dragoturkey.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Grillian's Cape
description:
This cape is supposed to protect your posterior from carnivorous plant bites.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Legend of the Dungeons Boots
description:
Their soles may be worn but these boots are very comfortable. They have trampled the soil of the most dangerous dungeons as well as the heads of the most vicious monsters.
(Place this pair of boots over another, already-equipped pair of boots to change their appearance.)

name: Pinokio Cape
description:
This wooden cape grows larger when you lie. There's a good chance you'll trip over it regularly as a result.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Stasili
description:
This very special, extremely rare rock is excavated by Enutrofs without them ever being able to find any value for it. Dark and crumbly, it cannot be used for construction, or as an ornament, and has very little commercial value. It would seem that its low resistance could make it an inexpensive form of protection. However, the most notable effect of this rock is to plunge the person who carries it into a deep depression.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Pol the Octopus's Hat
description:
Pol the Octopus, also known as the Frigostian Oracle, was capable of predicting the results of various tournaments and bets. He ended his life as a kebab, sliced up with some red and green peppers, some onions, drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with ground black pepper. Oh, but he was so delicious! *burp*
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Rogueraider
description:
A long time ago, a Rogue and a Masqueraider were rivals for the hand of a famous tailor. When she wouldn't give a response, the infuriated suitors asked her to make a mask in the effigy of whichever one of them she preferred. Unable to make up her mind, she made the Rogueraider, a mask which resembled both the Rogue and the Masqueraider. After consultation, the two suitors decided to go and fight over the hand of another tailor instead.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Tetra Hammer
description:
This hammer will fill the hole in your enemy's head perfectly.
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Boratt
description:
It probably won't surprise you to hear the hairs on this hat didn't come from anyone's head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Miss World of Twelve Amulet
description:
This amulet is the proof that you have been elected "most beautiful adventuress in the World of Twelve". Now you have to live with that burden and do all you can to retain your title. In the end, you'll probably regret the whole thing.
(Place this amulet over another, already-equipped amulet to change its appearance.)

name: Spacevader Hat
description:
With this hat on your head, you'll look out of this world. Or out of your mind. Probably the latter.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Escudo Epico
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Snarffe
description:
Rumour has it that this hat makes its wearer fluent in all animal languages. Careful, though: It would seem most of the monsters of Amakna have not inherited your great conversational skills, and greeting them amicably isn't going to discourage them from tearing you limb from limb.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Thundercape
description:
No one could really figure out what this strange cloak looked most like: a giant rat? A dinosaur? A being from another galaxy? In any case, one thing's for sure: it systematically causes disgust in the whole of the female population of the World of Twelve. Use it wisely.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Gladiahat
description:
This hat will protect you like no other against your opponents' blows. Careful, though: it won't protect you against being stabbed, cut, burnt, scorched, scratched, slapped, insect bites, clingy adventurers, bad jokes, your own stupidity…
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Wicked Roundel
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Tailblazer Hat
description:
This jaunty hat has an adjustable strap that pretty much guarantees you won't lose it on your adventures, even if you take a nasty tumble. Not only will you land on your feet, but your pride and dignity will remain happily intact.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Rat Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Amakna Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Okapicap
description:
The famous explorer Hariston Jaune wore a hat similar to this one. According to the legend, the Okapicap is magic: it whips up your curiosity while sharpening the mind. How excellent it would be if we placed this on the heads of dunces rather than a simple cone!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Cheekap
description:
This hat was invented by an anonymous tailor ahead of his time. Indeed, his market research revealed an upsurge in the number of poopy heads and fartfaces. He therefore decided to make a hat that would flatter them, and made a fortune in no time at all.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Cheekloak
description:
Trool underwear is much too big to be used thusly, even by you. But, since nothing can stop you once you get an idea in your head, you decided to wear them anyway by strapping them onto your back until your posterior was big enough.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Capnomen Tengu
description:
This ample cape will hide all your cheap gear, and if you stay perfectly still, you could even pass for a talented actor.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Hachetee
description:
This axe is a great way to ensure that tourists participate in a tea ceremony conforming to established norms. Hard to say how effective it is, though – the tourists can't ever be reached for comments afterwards.
(Place this axe over another, already-equipped axe to change its appearance.)

name: Geishead
description:
This wig is extremely popular with young Enutrofs, who use it to hide their characteristic baldness, which is itself caused by their hair constantly being yanked into a bun.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Black Quakape
description:
To collect the feathers required to make this cape, you'll need around a hundred Black Quaquacks and a cheese grater.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Yellow Quakask
description:
After playing the fool so often, you finally managed to become one for real. To reward you and to show their pride, your parents gave you this helmet.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Yellow Quakape
description:
Because blood would stain yellow feathers, Yellow Quakapes can't be manufactured the same way as Black Quakapes. For that reason, they take a lot longer to make.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Black Nincap
description:
Extremely evil and more than a little cowardly, the Black Ninja wears this cap to hide his identity. Like many adventurers, he can't take responsibility for his actions.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Dominairmees
description:
This cape: it gives you wings.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Pink Dragoodirks
description:
A typical example of the type of equipment that is all the rage not for its utility or (non-existent) efficiency, but for the fact that it could never go out of fashion according to the standards of prepubescent Eniripsas.
(Place this daggers over another, already-equipped daggers to change its appearance.)

name: Hammarita
description:
When she was just a young apprentice, Dolores Kimo used this hammer to help her commit sabotage. After everything froze over though, she traded it for a sword. Not as good for breaking machinery, but much better for intimidating tourists.
(Place this hammer over another, already-equipped hammer to change its appearance.)

name: Greenengol Shield
description:
An essential part of a Gobbowler's gear, the shield should be solid and block every blow. This one is just really pretty – it won't block anything, not even your adversaries' insults.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Draconic Helmet
description:
Embellished with this horn, you won't need to worry before charging into battle with your head down. Quite the contrary – now you have a reason to do just that.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Champion 644 Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Meow Cloak
description:
Fur, fur, fur and more fur. Fur everywhere!
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Black Madreggon
description:
You saw a red Madreggon, and you had it painted black. Black as night! Black as coal!
(Change the appearance of the petsmount you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Traffic Cloak
description:
With this cloak on your back, the militia will finally stop hounding you for stealing bits and pieces of Astrub for your private fortress.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Emperor Shield
description:
If only you were a little stronger and cooler, you could have used this shield as a shuriken.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Emperor Headgear
description:
Wearing this hat grants you the right to give the orders when you and your teammates are having fights… Snowball fights, that is!
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Droid Cloak
description:
The cloak of choice for all those adventurers who are stubborn, cheeky, and effortlessly adorable.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Crossbone Shovel
description:
This shovel is the ideal Kwismas present for gravediggers, gardeners, and diggers of gardeners' graves.
(Change the appearance of the shovel you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Suri-Me
description:
This pet walks sideways so as to always have its back to you. Either it hates you, or it trusts you implicitly.
(Change the appearance of the pet you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Mechanaxe
description:
The gear doesn't do anything, but it looks awesome. This axe really makes you think of someone for some reason.
(Change the appearance of the axe you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Mechanashield
description:
With this shield in your grubby hands, you can finally go backwards as well as forwards.
(Change the appearance of the shield you are carrying by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: XIV Cloak
description:
This cloak is excellent at hiding your lack of charisma, but it isn't quite long enough to hide your enormous posterior.
(Change the appearance of the cloak you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Al Howin's Shield
description:
This deformed eye blocks hits as well as any Iop skull.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Ridit Shield
description: If you like to read what others are doing over and over again, make acerbic and worthless remarks on nothing very important, or simply have the right to downvote in Amakna, this shield is for you.

name: Tumble Hat
description: When the Divine Dimensions were opened up to the people of the World of Twelve, everyone had a dream of creating their own dimension. When you wear this hat, you only need to close your eyes to be transported to your own personal dimension. You can then customise it to your liking and revel in the delight of all those who visit. Unfortunately, this paradise completely vanishes when you open your eyes.

name: Two-horned Hat
description:
Frustrated by constantly hearing her husband say he had the right horn but didn't know what to do with it, the baker's wife gave this hat to her husband so he had somewhere to put both his right horn and left horn.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Springy Cape
description:
Do not deflower this cape, or anything else, without consent.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Demonic Shield
description:
Loaded with demonic power, this shield will protect you from any attacks from other dimensions.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Charlie's Agents Hat
description:
Is there anything more disagreeable than getting a sunburn on holiday? Well, worry no more! This parasol-shaped hat will protect you from sun-related unpleasantness. As an added bonus, it will also make everyone else on the beach jealous of your undeniable cleverness.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Charlie's Agents Cloak
description:
This multi-purpose cloak will protect your behind from grains of sand when you arrive at Moon Beach. Now there's nothing to stop you from getting the best tan on the island!
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Redroz Shield
description:
If you're defeated, you'll no longer have to hide behind unlikely excuses. Now you can hide your shame behind this shield all day long.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Bakara's Cape
description:
In Bonta's colours, this cape gives its wearer the air of purity and candour. But, as they say, clothes don't make the mage…
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Monarch Crown
description:
He who wears the Monarch Crown is the one and only King of Bonta. So if you're wearing it… that must mean… that yours is a fake.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Julith's Sword
description:
The blows delivered by this sword are so powerful that the shockwaves they generate cut through everything in their path.
(Place this sword over another, already-equipped sword to change its appearance.)

name: Merkator Shield
description: You won't succeed in impersonating a Merkator Foggernaut just by holding this shield. But it should be enough to protect you from your enemies' attacks.

name: Seastaff
description:
There's nothing better to calm young Iops' zeal than a good whack of a Seastaff.
(Place this staff over another, already-equipped staff to change its appearance.)

name: Qilby's Shield
description:
Originating from another time, historians don't understand how this shield came to be found in the Dofus Era.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Mechadrhell
description:
Rather than raising flesh-and-blood Drhellers, Foggernauts prefer to make them out of spare parts. That way, they can change their appearance at will and provide them with any improvements they deem necessary.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Kwismas Bauble
description:
This fragile helmet is imbued with Kwismas magic. In other words, it allows you to exchange blows with comrades in an unparalleled moment of sharing. The winner is granted the right to steal the toys of their choice because, as is well known, the gifts of others are always the best.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Guild Headgear
description: With this headgear, adopt your Guild's style and say no to nonconformity.

name: Watchdog Headgear
description:
Only adventurers equipped with a Watchdog Headgear are allowed to sniff those who wear a Watchdog Cape.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Watchdog Cape
description:
This cape gives off a unique odour, allowing its wearer to be found if they get lost in the desert or on their way back from the tavern.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Dantinea's Shield
description: This shield was given to Dantinea when she was just a little girl, during the Miss Abysses contest, where the other candidates mysteriously disappeared before the prize was awarded. Nobody dares to question her title today, yet everyone knows that the mermaid Arielle Little is the most beautiful creature in the ocean.

name: Zadioc Headgear
description: This headgear will make you look like a knight. You may sleep while wearing it.

name: Hornmet
description:
Like Merlinmagus Ambrosius once said to an adventurer passing through Bonta: "Show me your wife! Then you'll know why you have horns."
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Paunchy Bow Meow
description:
The size of its stomach is proportional to its ego.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Brakmarian Bow Meow
description:
This particularly cheeky and undisciplined pet will give you the run-around. In comparison, raising children is a bed of roses.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Icky Boon
description:
Even clingier than your old classmate, of whom you've never really managed to rid yourself.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Tofury
description:
This petsmount is all the rage in farmyards.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Captivating Shield
description:
Something about this shield captivates you, but you can't quite put your finger on what – and it's keeping you awake at night. It is handsome – very handsome – but you've got better things to do at night than stare at it constantly, starting with getting rid of those horrid bags under your eyes or doing your homework.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Green Ninja Headband
description:
This orange headband may well be little out of fashion, but it's still effective: now you're a mysterious righter of wrongs, a defender of the oppressed! You'll have to rise to the occasion.
(Change the appearance of the headgear you are wearing by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Raccoon
description:
Behind its adorable appearance, the Raccoon is a cruel and highly meticulous animal. It both scares and impresses you at the same time: it'll always clean your enemies, do their makeup and dress them up properly, before finishing them off in cold blood. It's a weird habit, but one that has the merit of giving them a dignified death. You can have a clear conscience.
(Change the appearance of the pet you have equipped by dragging and dropping this item onto it.)

name: Air Knight Wings
description:
Morgan Forr, nicknamed the Air Knight, is an old man (in excellent shape for his age), who defends widows and orphans, along with his loyal flying destrier, Pier. He claims to be an "independent righter of wrongs" and says he used to be the god of a celestial island, back in the day. Perhaps he's lost his marbles after all those years of solitude, but he's still a hero in the eyes of the little people.
(Place this cape over another, already equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Air Knight Shield
description:
The Air Knight helps the most vulnerable by fighting for them when they get into trouble. He's given them a whistle so they can easily call him in case of difficulty. But clearly not everyone has the same understanding of the word "difficulty", so the knight has a very busy schedule that alternates between epic fights and thankless chores.
(Place this shield over another, already equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Dragnir
description:
This little dragon will take you to infinity and maybe beyond…
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Primordial Craftmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Primordial Smithmagus's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Primordial Carver's Shield
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Scarab Shield
description: The carapace used for this shield makes it extremely resistant but still light. Better keep a close grip on it. It'd be a shame to lose it with the first gust of wind – like you did your first love and your last hat.

name: Robust Cape
description:
Underneath its warrior-like appearance and unrivalled strength, this cape is soft and silky smooth. At long last, here's an item that will allow you to be both gentle and powerful at once.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Lagomorph Helmet
description:
The metal ears on this headgear amplify the sound of growling stomachs in those around you. It's ideal for hearing enemies approach, or verifying whether your friends are properly digesting the delicious meal you've reheated for the twelfth time.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Lagomorph Cape
description:
Is it a ball? Is it a tail? It doesn't matter. Either way, you wear it proudly.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Crypt Headgear
description:
This headgear will give you an excuse to look like something the dog dug up without having to mention last night's party.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Obsidemon Shield
description: The volcanic energy of Obsidemon radiating out of this shield makes it a very practical portable grill for anyone who loves outdoor cooking.

name: Corsair Cloak
description:
If by some odd twist of fate, your boat was ripped asunder, this solid cloak could replace it perfectly. Provided, of course, you had several dozen of the same model and sewed them all together, which leaves you plenty of time to go under.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Malicious Hat
description:
Unlike other hats of its kind, this magical hat never bends to its wearer's will, and its desires will go over your head.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Az'Hassin Shield
description:
This is not a shield. It is actually a kind of glider disguised as a shield, which the Az'Hassins raise above themselves before jumping from a high spot to enter or escape somewhere by air. Since its canvas is very fragile, a mere encounter with a small bird in flight could pierce it and make you fall. Also, even experienced Az'Hassins hardly use it, reluctant to end their lives in such an inglorious way.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Esspeakewlair Helmet
description:
Legend has it that this helmet belonged to the famous war chief named Romulu Ceremu. Taken in and raised by a Boowolf family when he was a boy, he grew up to become a powerful warrior and an ambitious conqueror. You must honour his name.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Vee'two Battler Shield
description:
"The fighter sharpens up his shield tirelessly, but only gets it out for good reason." — Vee'Two
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Monkiki'Ng Hat
description:
If you think you're teasing, mischievous or a joker right now, it's probably because of this headgear. Indeed, it has been imbued with the character of its former wearer, an impish little monkey whose main occupation was annoying the gods by playing bad tricks on them all day long. The monkey ended up being turned into a mountain, so go easy on the jokes.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Monkiki'Ng Cloak
description:
The staff attached to the back of this cloak has a very unusual power. It can change size at will, making this an item coveted by all, especially men who think that their virility depends on the size of their stick. It's often forgotten that too big a stick is impossible to handle, so why would you want a big stick at whatever cost if you're not going to use it?
(Place this cloak over another, already-equipped cloak to change its appearance.)

name: Storf
description:
The Storf is made up of magic snow, so it can stay at a very low temperature in any environment. This ability has not escaped those who like to drink cold beers under a blazing sun, who have therefore renamed it "The Icebox". Another fine example of conversion.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Prez' Doh'bivalent
description:
The label attached to the back of the Prez' says "from Auntie Nielleda". Better let it follow you than risk opening it.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Kwismas 648 Treetop
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Hyrkul Shield
description:
When Hyrkul was kind, he went to war on Saturdays. Now that he's mean, he goes to war all the time.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Tarantulino
description:
This carapace-covered mount loves bloody combat and stories that end poorly.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Noxcape
description: This cape will protect you while you're exploring dark, terrifying, and oh-so-exiting new places.

name: Noxshield
description: This shield shines with equal intensity day and night. Its manufacturer had no concept of energy efficiency.

name: Pocketwatch Shield
description:
Never let your guard down again when it's time to clean someone's clock.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Fleaster Topper
description:
This headgear will let you dress up as a Fleaster Wodent so you can hop through the bushes and scatter chocolate eggs to your heart's content. To each their own. We would never judge you for your hobbies.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Proto-Noxine
description:
An identical reproduction, made by an adventurer who has certified that he slipped into a temporal anomaly, this mechanical pet is perfect for studying your target before taking action. Be careful when looking up in the shower as its eye is very sensitive to shampoo splatter.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Viewshield
description:
Some like to see, and others like to be seen. Your heart seems caught between the two, unable to settle on either.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Tylezia Shield
description:
This shield is adorned with a ruby in a colour so bright that the Crocodyls will keep their distance from you.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Lucra Lucky Hat
description: Silam designed this hat for his friend, Lucra Lucky, who was looking for an inexpensive way to deal with the weather in Ohwymi. Made of flexible material, it fits narrow Piwi heads as well as it does adventurers' swollen heads.

name: Lezia
description: Many adventurers have fallen for Lezia's appearance, but very few are still around to talk about the chaos she can cause. Ignore this warning at your own risk and peril.

name: Veni Cape
description:
This cape will make your comings and goings more momentous.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Iop Shield
description:
An old saying, known to all good disciples of the god of bravery, claims that Iops must sometimes know how to use their heads. Purists decry the use of this shield instead of one's head to strike opponents. Still, you must admit this shield has certain appealing qualities.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Azure Shield
description: When you're done parading around, don't forget to hang this shield up on the wall and equip a real shield made for combat, or you'll get a nasty surprise when you find yourself in the middle of the action.

name: Azure Cape
description: This cape is designed to impress young boys and appeal to older girls. It works just as well the other way round.

name: Armurino
description:
Underneath this reinforced carapace, sharp horn and big eyes hides a faithful pet who will be as devoted to you as you've been to the White City.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Rogue Cape
description:
This cape provides efficient camouflage in the darker corners of the World of Twelve. However, wearing it about in broad daylight isn't recommended as the militia is likely to pounce on you very quickly.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Eybahl
description:
It would seem you've caught its eye…
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Kaspur
description:
This unobtrusive little ghost will follow you around without making a peep. Listen closely and you'll hear him say he's the friendliest ghost around.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Foggernaut Cloak
description:
This cloak is over 50% fabric, which is fairly surprising for a piece of Foggernaut equipment.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Ominous Helm
description:
They say that fortune favours the bold, but anyone bold enough to challenge someone wearing this helm will be sceptical of the saying.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Vanelle Sings Cape
description:
With this cape made from real Boowolf hairs, you won't catch a cold in the freezing corridors of Forfut Manor.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Imaginary Dreamshield
description: This shield is quite tangible in spite of its name. Each blow is a painful reminder of its very material condition.

name: Ratalda
description: The gem on her forehead allows Ratalda to accurately determine the beginning of the year of the rat. Since the invention of the calendar, the little rat has unfortunately had a hard time harnessing this talent.

name: Little Moushu Headgear
description:
Nobody knows if Moushu was a little mouse or just a little girl who liked mice. One thing is certain: both stories are told every new year of the rat.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Little Moushu Shield
description:
Forged to celebrate the year of the rat, this small ornamental shield is so refined that it'd be a shame to use it in combat.
(Place this shield over another, already-equipped shield to change its appearance.)

name: Last Hope Cape
description:
It's not enough to oppose the evil forces hanging over the World of Twelve – you've got to do it in style. This cape is a perfect example of that.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Minibora
description: Being tall isn't always an advantage when it comes to time travel. Less mass to transport means more opportunities to create paradoxes that could give a narrator nightmares.

name: Corruption Death Cap
description:
If you've ever ridden a Dragoturkey, you'll know that a quality saddle is crucial to avoid chafing and itching. If you plan to ride this Death Cap, make sure you have an even better saddle, because you definitely don't want to feel the itching come to life.
(Place this petsmount over another, already-equipped petsmount to change its appearance.)

name: Feca Headgear
description:
Donning this golden horned headgear will show everyone that luxury and elegance are your thing, but no one will dare comment on it to your face.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Masqueraider Cape
description:
The perfect finishing touch to any disguise is a cape. This one will add a considerable class to your mysterious style.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)

name: Griffined Hood
description:
This hood reminds you of the days when wearing a hood in class let you copy off your neighbours without the teacher seeing where you were really looking. The acronym "HDFLL" on the label has you completely stumped, however.
(Place this headgear over other, already-equipped headgear to change its appearance.)

name: Donfus
description:
This pet is cute enough to bite, both literally and figuratively. And that's not all! Its cuteness is made even better by its practicality thanks to the hole in its back where you can insert anything and everything – especially anything – safely.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Weebamboo
description:
Don't be fooled by its nonchalant air: the Weebamboo is a fearsome fighter and always eager to give you a hand in a scrape.
(Place this pet over another, already-equipped pet to change its appearance.)

name: Bamboo Flask
description:
Cloaks are annoying – always getting underfoot and tripping you up. A flask full of bamboo milk, however, always comes in handy.
(Place this cape over another, already-equipped cape to change its appearance.)
